column2: You have been appointed as a project manager for a new project. After several months, you find that the accounting department has reject all charges because the project was not approved. What should the project manager have done to prevent this?
column3: Obtained the fund needed to start the project
column4: Planned the resources necessary to start the project
column5: Verified that the business case was authorized by the project initiator
column6: Get the project charter approval from the project sponsor
column7: The sponsor or initiator of the project Is responsible to establish (approve and issue) the charter and can take the help of the prospect project manager to develop it. The project manager should obtain the project charter approval from the project sponsor because the project charter is a document that formally authorizes the existence of a project al d provides the project manager with the authority to apply organizational resources to project activities. [PMBOK 6th edition page, 75].

column2: A project progressing on time and within budget is 40 days away from achieving its main milestone. The project manager then learns that a key component to achieve this milestone will be unavailable for 60 days. What should the project manager do?
column3: Send an amended progress report to all stakeholders.
column4: Notify stakeholders at the next project status meeting.
column7: Because ( milestone will be unavailable for 60 days.) This Is an example of an issue and should be documented In the issue log. The Issue log will help the project manager effectively track and manage Issues, ensuring that they are investigated and resolved. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 96]

column6: Refer to the risk register and inform key stakeholders
column7: As an unexpected power outage occurs, the project manager should first Refer to the risk register and inform key stakeholders to handle this scenario. column2: A project manager wants to recruit another team member to replace an engineer who retired. What document should capture this change?
column7: Responsibility assignments matrix RAMS are used within the group to designate roles, responsibilities, and levels of authority for specific activities. The matrix format shows all activities associated with one person and alt people associated with one activity. This also ensures that there is only one person accountable for each task to avoid confusion about who is ultimately in charge or has authority for the work. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 317]

column2: While creating the probability and impact matrix, what should the project manager and his team consider to support the project risk analysis?
column5: Contingency reserve for budget and schedule.
column6: Possible effects on the objectives of the project.
column7: The most important element that should the team and project manager consider while creating the probability and Impact matrix Is the Possible effects on the objectives of the project by taking the highest priority level regardless of which objective Is affected. [PMBOK 6th edition page, 425]

column2: You are a project manager in a construction project. The project is ahead of schedule and under budget. A key stakeholder suggests a change to include a value-added feature that wouldn't impact project schedule and cost. What should you do next?
column3: Advise the stakeholder that, since the project is under budget. the feature will be added
column4: Advise the stakeholder that changes shouldn't be implemented when a project is behind schedule.
column5: Update the project management plan to include the new feature.
column6: Evaluate the change's impact with the project team.
column7: The change does not Impact the schedule and cost but the project manager should evaluate the change's impact on the other constrains with the project team. [PMBOK 6th edition page, 90]

column2: In your project, the Schedule Performance Index SPI is 0.7, and Cost Performance Index CPI 1.1. You analyzed the baseline and decided to return the schedule back to meet the baseline. You will:
column5: Check tasks which can be removed from baseline.
column6: Check options of crashing or fast-tracking the project.
column7: SPI = 0.7 and CPI = 1.1 mean that the [Project is behind schedule and under budget. In this case, the project manager should Crash the project to meet the baseline. [PMBOK 6th edition page.263]

column2: An experienced engineer is hired to supervise a subcontractor hired for a project. The experienced engineer uses an effective cost control technique, but it is not the agreed-upon technique for the project. This causes conflicts with the integration group reconciling the monthly reports. What should the project manager do?
column3: Force the new employee to follow the agreed-upon technique.
column4: Initiate a change request to resolve the issue.
column5: Search for solutions that are similar to the existing technique.
column6: Emphasize the advantage of the new method and change the technique with which costs are managed.
column7: The experienced engineer uses an effective cost control technique, so the project manager should emphasize the advantage of the new method and change the technique with which costs are managed. The option (initiate a change request to resolve the issue) not correct because no need to issue a change request to solve this issue. The option (Search for solutions that are similar to the existing technique) not correct because the experienced engineer uses an effective cost control technique. The option (Force the new employee to follow the agreed upon technique) will Increase the conflict and will not solve the issue.  [PMBOK 6th edition. Page 257]

column2: During project closure and transferring of the completed project deliverables to the operation department, the project manager discovers that an audit report from an early project phase is missing. What should the project manager do?
column3: Remove the audit report from the required project documents and update the project management plan.
column4: Ask the operation department representative to accept the project without the audit report.
column5: Complete project closure and update the OPA
column6: Inform the operation department representative about the missing audit report.
column7: Ethically, the project manager must Inform the operation department representative about the missing audit report. [PMBOK 6th edition. Page 121]

column2: You are managing a project that is in its first month of execution. In one of the meetings, a key stakeholder asks for some changes to be made in the ongoing work. The stakeholder is asking for the changes to be implemented immediately. You realize that the changes being asked for will require update the Project Management Plan and the Scope baseline, which have already been baselined. As a Project manager, which is the best course of action?
column3: Make the changes as they are being asked for by a key stakeholder
column4: Refuse to make the changes as it is a deviation from approved
column5: Scope Analyze the impact of the changes on triple constraints
column6: Generate a change request and submit it to Integrated change control
column7: Any changes being asked for or requested to any approved plan need to be formally reviewed by the Change Control Board. [PMBOK 6th edition. Page 113]

column2: After stakeholders in a company's sales department examined all the deliverables, they state that there has been a change in the company strategy. Therefore, important changes must be made to the requirements. The project manager believes that these changes make the deliverables unstable. What should the project manager do?
column3: Evaluate and incorporate the changes to the project management plan to start executing them.
column4: Request the details about the new requirements. evaluate them with the project team. and recommend whether to continue or close the project.
column5: Evaluate the impact on the project. coordinate with the sponsor and close the project.
column6: Request that the stakeholders specify the new requirements and present them to the change control board (CCB).
column7: Since the changes are Important and MUST be made to the requirements so the PM need to make it. Any changes In project requirement can impact the baseline will require formal change request to take the approval from CCB. The project manager should request the stakeholders to specify the new requirements and present them to the change control board (CCB). Options of implement the changes without the approval of CCB are not correct . Also close the project after evaluate the Impact on project is not correct. [PMBOK 6th edition. Page. 167]

column7: The risk register Is updated when appropriate risk responses are chosen and agreed upon. [PMBOK 6th edition. Page. 448]

column2: A change request has been approved to add additional scope to a project. The change will increase the project duration by one month and will increase the budget by $50,000. What should the project manager do next?
column3: Add resources to bring the schedule back on track.
column4: Implement the approved change by following the project management plan.
column5: Use management reserves to cover the cost of the change.
column6: Communicate the change to the relevant stakeholders.
column7: In this case, the decision has been made (the change request has been approved); therefore, the decision should be communicated to the relevant stakeholders. Typically, the decisions are communicated in accordance with the guidelines specified in the project's communications management plan which establishes how, when, and by whom information about the project will be administered and disseminated [PMBOK 6th edition., Page 120].

column2: You are managing a project with a budget of $9,000, and $1,500 has been spent. However, you only completed $1,000 worth of work. Your schedule says that you should have completed 50% of the work. What is the estimate at completion (EAC)?
column7:
The used formulas: EAC = BAC/CPI and CPI = EV/AC
CPI = 1000/1500 = 0.66 
So, EAC = 9000 / 0.66 = 13,500  (Based on performance data).
 [PMBOK 6th edition., Page 263]

column2: You are managing a IT project. After identifying risks, you start the qualitative risk analysis process and now you are going to prioritize them. Which of the following techniques you are going to use?
column7: After Identifying risks, your next step will be to prioritize them. To do so you will use the probability and impact matrix. [PMBOK 6th edition. Page 408]

column2: During the planning phase of your project, the project and product requirements have been identified by the project team. Which of the following tools and techniques will be used to accomplish this?
column3: Network diagram, benchmarking, and project scope statement.
column4: Mind mapping, affinity diagram, and brainstorming.
column5: Observations conversations, trend analysis, and work breakdown structure (WBS).
column6: Observations conversations, benchmarking, and affinity diagram.
column7: You can easily remove two options that include Network Diagram and WBS. Also, Mind mapping and Brainstorming both used to generate new ideas so not a good choice. So tools to Identify the project and product requirements are Observations Conversations, Benchmarking, and Affinity Diagram. [PMBOK 6th edition page, 142]

column2: Task B is dependent upon task A which is delayed. Resource for task B have limited availability and you must begin task B on time. What should you do to replan the schedule so that the deadline not changed?
column3: Fast track task A and move task B's start date.
column4: Fast track task B and immediately begin work.
column5: Replan task B start date so it begins after the completion of task A
column6: Crash task A and start task B at the planned time.
column7: The relation between task A and B is (FS) and the task A Is delayed, so you should focus on crashing task A and start task B at the planned time so that the deadline not changed. Option (Fast track task B and immediately begin work) not correct because resources for task B have limited availability. Option (Fast track task A and move task B's start date.) not correct because the deadline will change. Option (Replan task B's start date so It begins after the completion of task A.) not correct because the deadline will change. [PMBOK 6th edition page, 215]

column2: You are a project manager in an IT project. You and key stakeholders start conducting a project benefit analysis. Because of the solutions that have not been identified, an engineer from another department has informed you that there are affected systems. As a project manager, what should you do?
column5: Review the project benefit analysis to consider the additional impact
column6: Document the issue in the issue log.
column7: The Issue log is a project document used to Identify and monitor issues that occur In the project. The issue log can be updated with any new issues found during the project and described In the scenario because of the solutions that have not been identified causing the system are affected. This choice "Document the issue in the issue log" is the best answer. [PMBOK 6th edition page, 453]

column2: You are working in a matrix organization and managing a construction project. The functional manager moved some resources you need from your project to another project. What should you do next?
column4: Escalate this problem to the sponsor
column5: Complete the project without this resources
column6: Negotiate with functional manager to assign a new resources
column7: In matrix organizations environment the project manager should effectively negotiate and influence others who are in a position to provide the required team and physical resources for the project. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 329].

column2: A change request has been approved by the change control board CCB. You want to make sure that this change has been implemented correctly. Which process will ensure this?
column7: As part of the Perform Integrated Change Control process, a change log update Indicates that some changes are approved and some are not. Approved change request may include modification such as defect repairs, revised work methods, and revised schedules. Partial change completion may result in inconsistencies and later delays due to incomplete steps or corrections, The implementation of approved changes should be verified, confirmed for completeness, retested, and certified as correct. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 301]

column2: As part of earned value management (EVM), The budget at completion (BAC) for the project is SAR 100,000 and the estimate at completion (EAC) is SAR 130,000. If the schedule performance index (SPI) is equal to 1.0. What is the cost performance index (CPI)?
column7:
EAC = BAC / CPI 
So: CPI = BAC / EAC
       CPI = 100,000/130,000 = 0.77 
       CPI Less than 1.0 
[PMBOK 6th edition, Page 267]

column13: EAC = BAC / CPI ι¨ιθ: CPI = BAC / EAC CPI = 100?000 / 130?000 = 0.77 CPI ηι κλ 1.0 [PMBOK ια γ΅ ι«§«΅ ? ι­ε¥΅ 267]

column2: As the project manager of a large project, you are determining the accuracy of the deliverables before closing a project. What process should be used to determine this and is an input to formalizing acceptance?
column7: Validate Scope is the process of formalizing acceptance of the completed project deliverables. The verified deliverables obtained from the Control Quality process are reviewed with the customer or sponsor to ensure they are completed satisfactorily and have received formal acceptance of the deliverables by the customer or sponsor. Verified deliverables is the key inputs of validate scope process and outputs of Control quality process. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 164].

column2: Which of the following statements is correct regarding the kickoff meeting?
column3: Just to inform and engage stakeholders
column6: Kickoff meeting is conducted not only to inform but also to engage and gain commitment from stakeholders
column7:
The kickoff meeting is conducted to communicate the start of the project, the key milestones, and other information to inform and engage stakeholders and gain their commitment.
[PMBOK 6th edition, Page 86

column2: You are calculates the amount of float on various paths in the network diagram to determine the minimum project duration. Which tool or technique you are using to do this?
column7: The critical path method is used to estimate the minimum project duration and determine the amount of schedule flexibility on the logical network paths within the schedule model. A critical path is normally characterized by zero total floats on the critical path. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 210]

column2: As part of a strategy to handle negative risk, a project manager decided to do less complex processes, add more tests, and deal with more stable supplier. What strategy would this be classified as?
column7: Actions such as doing less complex processes, add more test, or dealing with more stable supplier would be considered mitigation. These actions reduce the probability and impact of risks. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 443]

column2: Which of the following components of a project scope statement is useful in reducing scope creep?
column7: Project exclusions identifies what is excluded from the project. Explicitly stating what is out of scope for the project helps manage stakeholders? expectation and can reduce scope creep. Other choices cannot help more in this regard. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 154]

column2: Which of the following statements most accurately describes a project scenario?
column3:
Changes in project scope
during the initial phases of the
project are very expensive
column4: The influence of the stakeholders is the same all through the project
column5: The next phase of a project should never start until the deliverables for the previous phase are completely reviewed and approved
column6:
Staffing peaks are in the
execution phase of a project
column7: Staffing is typically highest during the execution phase of the project. The other three responses may not hold true. Projects can move forward into subsequent phases without the deliverables of the prior phase being completely approved; this is known as fast tracking. Changes during the initial phases of the project are the least expensive. The influence of the stakeholders is highest during the start of the project and declines as the project moves to completion. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 549]

column2: Which of these types of precedence relationships is least commonly used in the Precedence Diagramming Method?
column7: Start to Finish relationships indicate that the next task cannot be completed until the one preceding it has started. This type is not commonly used. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 190]

column2: A contractor is currently constructing a new building for your organization on a cost-plus-incentive contract. You just received the project status report from the contractor?s project manager. According to the report, the project?s CPI is 1.5. You are shocked because you believe the project costs are out of control. Upon investigation, you learn the $1 million advance payment (20 percent of the estimated project cost) given to the contractor at the start of the project was included in the project?s earned value. Further, the cost of the inventory at the project site was excluded from the total actual costs. According to the contract, your company reimburses only the costs for the completed deliverables and not for the supplies in the project?s inventory. In this scenario, the reported project?s CPI is incorrect because:
column4: Earned value is overstated, and actual cost is understated
column5: Both the earned value and the actual cost are overstated
column7: In this scenario the earned value has been overstated while the reported actual cost is ok. Earned value should be the sum of PVs of all completed activities. The initial 20% advance should not be part of this. Further, since the buyer is not liable for the inventory cost and only reimburses the costs associated with completed deliverables, the cost of the inventory does not become part of the actual cost until that inventory is consumed during the construction process. The inventory is an asset for the contactor until it is consumed on the project and at that time it becomes a cost for the project. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 267]

column2: Increasing the number of resources in order to crash a project schedule does not always cut the time by the same factor. In worst cases, too many resources assigned to an activity may actually increase the activity duration. This is because:
column5: Additional risk introduced due to crashing
column7: Increasing the number of resources in order to crash a project schedule does not always cut the time by the same factor. In worst cases, too many resources to the activity may actually increase the duration due to required additional coordination. Other choices are either not applicable or do not directly influence the project schedule. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 197]

column2: The Requirements Traceability Matrix helps in tracing all the following except:
column7: Requirements Traceability Matrix is an output of the Collect Requirements process. It is used for tracing requirements to project scope, objectives, and test strategy. Tracing requirements to project risk is not a valid use. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 149]

column2: Julia is currently recruiting her project team. She has carried out various interviews and has shortlisted potential candidates. Now, according to the project communication management plan, she has to submit the shortlisted profiles to the project client (customer) for approval. Only then, can she formally hire the approved candidates for the project. The submission of the profiles to the client will go through which of the following processes?
column7:
Manage Communications is the process of distributing project information in accordance to the communications management plan. The interviews and shortlisting was carried out during the Acquire Resources and so will be the hiring once the approvals come in. However, the
profiles submission to the client will be done through the Manage Communications process. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 379]

column2: What does a Cost Performance Index (CPI) of more than 1.0 indicate?
column4: The project is right on budget
column5:
The project is ahead of
schedule
column7: The CPI is calculated as the earned value divided by the actual cost. An index of greater than one indicates that you have spent less than you forecasted to this point. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 263]

column2: Which of the following is a tool or technique of the Develop Team process?
column7: Colocation is a tool and technique of the Develop Team process. The other choices are not valid responses. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 336]

column2: A project manager must stress the importance of collecting and documenting lessons learned through the project lifecycle. One good way to collect this information is during weekly status meetings. Usually, weekly status meetings, if not managed properly, end up in firefighting since most of the time, attention goes to the burning issues. How can you ensure that the lessons-learned gathering does not get missed in such a situation?
column3:
Record the minutes of the
meeting
column4:
Do not discuss burning issues
in weekly status meetings
column5: Replace status update meetings with one-on-one meetings with the team members
column7: A good approach is to add a lessons-learned agenda item to the meeting. As the meeting progresses to the point where you?re ready to collect lessons-learned information, ask each team member about his or her positive and negative experiences for the week. Don?t mention the words ?lessons learned? to them; just capture what went right and wrong from every team member. Do your best to prevent this part of the meeting from devolving into a complaint session. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 379] [PMI best practice]

column2: Which document describes the project's deliverables and the work required to create those deliverables?
column7: The project scope statement is the correct response. This document describes the project's deliverables in detail and the work that is required to create those deliverables. It also forms the baseline for evaluating whether requests for changes are within or outside the project's boundaries. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 154]

column2: The term Progressive Elaboration incorrectly represents which of the following?
column4:
Detailing out the product
requirements developed during
the initiation process
column5: Production of fabrication and construction drawings from the design drawings for a chemical plant.
column7: The distinction between progressive elaboration and scope creep needs to be understood since the two terms are different. The changes to scope (especially in an uncontrolled manner) are called scope creep. In contrast, progressive elaboration involves building on or elaborating the output of a previous phase. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 185]

column2: While analyzing a project, the project manager calculated the ratio of the Earned Value (EV) to the Actual Costs (AC) and obtained a value of 1.2. The project manager decided this was an unfavorable condition for the project and decided to take corrective action. What is your view?
column3: The project manager is correct. The ratio of EV to AC is the Cost Performance Index and a ratio greater than 1 is unfavorable to the project
column4: The project manager is not correct. The ratio of EV to AC is the Cost Variance and a ratio greater than 1 is favorable to the project
column5: The project manager is correct. The ratio of EV to AC is the Cost Variance and a ratio greater than 1 is unfavorable to the project
column6: The project manager is not correct. The ratio of EV to AC is the Cost Performance Index and a ratio greater than 1 is favorable to the project
column7: The project manager is not correct. Cost Performance Index (CPI) is the ratio of EV to AC. A value greater than one represents a favorable condition for the project. The project manager has misinterpreted the situation. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 263]

column2: As a project manager, you are responsible for determining and delivering the required levels of both grade and quality. Select which of the following statements you disagree with.
column3:
Grade relates to the product's
characteristics
column4:
Quality relates to the customer
requirements
column5:
Quality and grade of a product
must be carefully managed
column6:
Grade relates to the
customer requirements
column7: The grade of a product relates to the technical characteristics of the product. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 274]

column2: Ahmad has worked for a retail company as a project manager. With his positive thinking and strong managerial skills, he turned many potentially disastrous projects into successes. Because of his expertise, his employer?s senior executives offered him a group project manager position for a newly started environmental project. However, Ahmad learned that, in his newly assigned project, he might have to offer bribes to obtain government licenses. What should Ahmad do in such a situation?
column3: Accept the offer because project managers must obey their higher-ups
column4: Accept the position and offer bribes because project managers must complete projects on time and within budget
column5: Investigate to find out if it is customary to offer bribes in that part of the country
column6: Reject the offer because project managers should not engage in an unethical conduct
column7: Project managers must adhere to the code of ethics and professional conduct. They must maintain fairness and honesty. Since the new job requires some illegal and unethical activities, Ahmad must reject the offer. [PMI code of Ethics and Professional Conduct] [Prof. Responsibility][PMBOK 6th edition, Page 3]

column2: Nada is managing a complex industrial process reengineering project. She has identified all her key project stakeholders and has conducted individual interviews with them to identify other project stakeholders, as well. However, Nada is still not satisfied with her project?s stakeholders list; she believes there may be more key external stakeholders missing from the list. What can help Nada in this situation?
column3: Use stakeholder register templates from the organizational process assets
column4: Conduct more meetings with the key stakeholders
column5: Get over her fear and finalize the project stakeholder register
column6: Seek expert judgment from subject matter experts
column7: The stakeholder register template does not contain stakeholders information; it only helps the project manager produce the project's stakeholder register. If Nada is not satisfied with the list, she needs to identify more stakeholders until she is satisfied. Interviewing the identified key stakeholders again might not resolve the issue. The best option is to seek an expert's opinion. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 511]

column2: There are several communication methods used to share and distribute information to stakeholders, team members, and management. Which of the following communication methods is used when you notify the public about environmental effects from your project after implementation by posting reports on the project's website?
column7: Push communication is used to send information to specific recipients who need to know. Push communication is done using letters, faxes, memos, etc. Pull communication is used for large volumes of information. The methods for this type of communication include internet sites and blogs. Since you want to notify the general public about environmental effects by posting reports on the project's website, this is an example of pull communication methods. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 374]

column2: Ali is in the execution phase of his project. He is getting unexpected requests from his stakeholders about the project?s progress. Ali can use all the following to respond to their requests except:
column7: Since Ali is in the execution phase and stakeholders are requesting project information, he must respond through the Manage Communications process. The communications management plan, organizational process assets and work performance reports are inputs to this process. Ali can use any of these documents to respond to their requests. The project's business case is not of much help at this stage. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 379]

column2: Salwa has to brief her key project stakeholders on the recent approved changes to the project scope. Which of the following project documents will provide essential input to Salwa for preparing her presentation?
column7: The change control procedure and the issue management procedure are organizational process assets. They do not document the details of the recently approved project changes. Lucy can find all the essential inputs for her presentation in the project change log. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 120]

column2: You have recently taken over a troubled automobile project, which has gone out of control. The project team missed many deadlines, and stakeholders were displeased with the project?s progress. As an experienced project manager, your first priority is to align the schedule with the project plan. You would like to use what-if scenario analysis to see how various factors affected the project schedule so you can develop a plan to reduce the impact of adverse conditions on the project schedule in the future. What would be your next course of action be, once you determine the factors that created schedule overruns?
column3: Prepare a resource breakdown structure to identify resources used
column4: Update activity lists to incorporate new activities into the schedule
column5: Develop project schedule network diagrams to determine the total slack
column6: Generate change requests for a corrective action
column7: You are in the process of determining the status of the project schedule and investigating the factors that caused schedule changes. From this scenario, you are currently in the Control Schedule process. What-if analysis is used in the Control Schedule process to see how various factors influence the schedule. One output of this process is to generate change requests to correct the schedule. Hence, you should generate a change request for the required corrective action. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 229]

column2: You are in the Validate Scope process of your electronic goods manufacturing project. While reviewing some products, you have noticed that the tolerance for one product is 0.01 percent less than what was listed in the requirements documentation. This deviation may not be a problem for the customers, and it may not impair the product?s operation. What is your best immediate action in such a situation?
column3: Change the project management plan to allow for small deviation
column4: Reject all products and restart the project
column5: Discuss with your team about the quality testing
column6: Notify the stakeholders about the deviation
column7: When you find a defective product, you must notify stakeholders immediately even if the deviation may not affect customers. As a project manager, you must maintain honesty and should not hide facts. After notifying the stakeholders, the project manager must discuss the issue with the team and change the project management plan based on the stakeholders? inputs. [PMI Code of Ethics and Professional Conduct] [Prof. Responsibility]

column2: A project manager has just started planning his project. If he has only limited information about the project, he should use the following technique to estimate the duration for each activity using historical data from a similar project:
column7: When there is a limited amount of information available about a project, analogous estimating is used to estimate the activity durations. This estimating technique uses parameters such as budget, complexity and size from previous projects to estimate the duration. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 200]

column2: You just completed the first phase of a multi-phase project. You have calculated earned value measurements and found that the current CPI is 0.79 and the current SPI is 0.98. Your next phase plan should focus first on which element of the project:
column7: A Schedule Performance Index (SPI) of less than one indicates that less work has completed than planned, and a Cost Performance Index (CPI) of less than one indicates a cost overrun for the work completed. In this scenario, the cost overrun is more severe than the schedule delay. Therefore, you should focus on reducing the cost of the project. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 263]

column13: ο¬ο© κ›¬© § ι¤§νι (SPI) ι¨ο οηι γλ ν¥§ ιξ λμ Άκ θκι γκι ηι κκ μν κ¦αα ιμ ? νο¬ο© κ›¬© § ιΆθιε΅ (CPI) ι¨ο οηι γλ ν¥§ ιξ Ά¤ν Άθιε΅ ιγκι ικθΆκι. εο μ¨ ι«ολ©ον ? οθνλ Ά¤ν ιΆθιε΅ θ£© ¥§΅ κλ Ά¦ο© ι¤§νι. ι¨ιθ ? ο¤  ιΆ©θο γιξ Άηιοι Άθιε΅ ικ¬©νγ. [ια γ΅ ι«§«΅ κλ PMBOK ? ι­ε¥΅ 263]

column2: Which document defines how the project is to be executed, monitored, controlled, and closed?
column7: The project management plan defines how the project is executed, monitored, controlled, and closed. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 83]

column2: Which of the following is neither an input to nor an output of the Develop Project Charter process?

column2: Your project team has recently identified a risk in the software development project and decided not to change the project management plan to deal with the risk. The risk response strategy that your team used in this scenario is an example of:
column7: When risks cannot be handled or managed in a project, it is advisable to accept them. In this scenario, your team is unable to devise a suitable response strategy. Hence, risk acceptance is the correct strategy to employ. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 443]

column2: All the following activities are performed in the Close Project or Phase process except:
column3: Activities that fulfill the exit criteria of the project

column5: Documenting the reasons for terminating the projects early
column6: Sending the deliverables to the customer for acceptance
column7: Sending the deliverables to the customer for acceptance is an activity of the Validate Scope process. The other choices are activities related to the Close Project or Phase process. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 123]

column2: You are working as a project manager for a high-yield crop development project. Data from the weather agency shows an unfavorable weather pattern for the next few months. As a senior project manager, you want to assess the schedule?s feasibility under adverse conditions and provide some insights to your team. That way, your team can prepare some reserves and plan risk responses if unfavorable conditions exist during execution. Which of the following techniques should you use to simulate risks and other sources of uncertainty to calculate possible schedule outcomes?
column7: Modeling techniques are used to prepare a schedule under various scenarios. These techniques help assess the feasibility of the project schedule if adverse conditions exist. The Monte Carlo technique employs simulation to calculate multiple project durations, each with a different set of activity assumptions using a probability distribution. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 213] [Project Schedule Management]

column2: You are managing a heavy equipment manufacturing project that involves many mechanical, electrical, and IT staff. Your team prepared a schedule network diagram using duration estimates with dependencies and constraints. Your team also calculated the critical path for the project using late and early values. Today, your project office has indicated to you that some of the resources you had planned for the project will be unavailable. To deal with this, you explore the possibility of modifying the schedule to account for limited resources. What is your best possible step in such a situation?
column3: Perform Resource Leveling to account for limited resources
column4: Use crashing or fast tracking to level resources across the project
column5: Apply leads and lags to develop a viable schedule
column6: Recalculate critical path after applying the resource constraints
column7: The critical path method is used to prepare a schedule network diagram. A network diagram is prepared initially, and the critical path is then calculated. Availability of resources is entered, and a resource limited schedule is prepared. Hence, recalculating the critical path using the critical path method after applying the resource constraints is the next best step. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 210]

column2: You are working with your customers on completing deliverables in your electronic parts manufacturing project. Since these parts will be exported to other countries, they will need more testing before your customers accept them. In this scenario, which of the following statements about the completed deliverables is correct?
column3: Completed deliverables not accepted by customers must be forwarded to the close project or phase process.
column4: Deliverables formally accepted by customers must be moved to organizational process assets.
column5: Deliverables formally accepted by customers are forwarded to the validate scope process.
column6: Completed deliverables not accepted by customers must require a change request for defect repair.
column7: Validate Scope is the process of formalizing the acceptance of finished deliverables. In this process, stakeholders or customers give formal acceptance of the completed deliverables. The accepted deliverables are forwarded to the Close Project or Phase process. If there are any completed deliverables that they do not accept, a change request for defect repair must be initiated. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 166]

column2: You are managing a project for a customer that has just gone bankrupt and is subject to liquidation proceedings. There are several outstanding invoices this customer has not paid to your company. What should you do now?
column5: Send the invoices to the bankruptcy attorneys

column7: You are responsible for finding the right way to handle this situation. Contact your management for advice on how to proceed. column2: The RACI chart is an example of a responsibility assignment matrix (RAM). The letters R and C in ?RACI? stand for:
column7: The responsibility assignment matrix (RAM) describes the relationship between resources and work packages. An RACI chart is an example of a RAM. The letters in ?RACI? stand for Responsible, Accountable, Consult, and Inform. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 317]

column2: Project costs are estimated for all project activities and are aggregated to establish a cost baseline. Which of the following statements about the cost baseline is not true?
column3: The project cost performance is measured against the cost baseline.

column7: The project cost baseline includes all authorized budgets excluding management reserves. Management reserves are not included to measure the cost performance of a project. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 248]

column2: The project you are working on has received an invoice from a vendor for US$17,500. However, your team believes the correct total due is US$15,300. When you notify the vendor, the vendor still insists on US$17,500. What is the best course of action now?
column7: Negotiate with the vendor. Making a unilateral decision is counter to the PMI Code of Ethics, which mandates good faith negotiations. Failing to negotiate will not be in the best interest of either the project or the vendor. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 498; PMI Code of Ethics and Professional Conduct] [Prof. Responsibility]

column2: The method used in the Manage Quality process to identify the factors that may influence specific characteristics of a product under development is:
column7:
Design for X is a set of technical guidelines that may be applied during the design of a product for the optimization of a specific aspect of the design. Daft can control or even improve the product's final
characteristics. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 295]

column7: Follow all company directives. The organization?s management is responsible for developing these directives, which may include specific instructions on closing out work in progress. [PMI Code of Ethics and Professional Conduct] [Prof. Responsibility]

column2: Which of the following is an output of the Create WBS process?
column7: The scope baseline is an output of the Create WBS process. The other choices are either inputs or tools and techniques of the process. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 156]

column2: Mervat an IT project manager, is in the planning phase of a shopping website development project. A junior project manager, who has worked under her authority, started developing procedures for maintaining the integrity of cost and schedule performance baselines in the project. Where should the junior project manager store these procedures?
column3: In the project resource management plan
column5: In the project communications management plan
column7: The baselines change only when a change request is generated. A project management plan documents the procedures for making changes to performance baselines. These baselines include scope, cost and schedule baselines. Therefore, the junior project manager must store these procedures in the project management plan. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 88]

column2: Fatimah can bid on two projects. Project A has a 50 percent return on investment while Project B has a 20 percent return on investment. Project A?s scope of work is complex, and Fatimah?s organization does not have the necessary skills and experience to do this project. However, Project B?s scope of work falls within the strengths of Fatimah?s organization. Which project must Fatimah bid on?
column3: None as this is a conflict of interest situation
column4: Both since the overall profit will be higher
column5: Project A since the return on investment is the highest
column6: Project B since the organization has the required skills
column7: Fatimah must not bid on Project A since her organization lacks the required skills and experience. This leaves her with only Project B to bid on. Project managers are mandated by the PMI's code of ethics and professional conduct to accept only those assignments that are consistent with their background, experience, skills and qualifications. [PMI Code of Ethics & Professional Conduct] [Prof. Responsibility]

column2: Organizations evaluate whether to buy products or make the items themselves. Which of the following is not a factor that influences make-or-buy decisions:
column4: Value delivered by vendors meeting the need
column5: Risk associated with meeting the need in a cost-effective manner
column7: A make-or-buy analysis results in a decision as to whether particular work can best be accomplished by the project team or needs to be outsourced. The total duration of the project does not (and should not) influence this analysis. The other choices are rational considerations during this analysis. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 479]

column2: A project manager is spending most of the project funding in the current phase of the project. The manager is also managing various resources in the project. What is the stakeholder influence on the project now compared to earlier phases?
column7: Since the project manager is spending most of the money and managing resources, he or she is currently in the execution phase of the project. Spending levels reach a maximum in the execution phase. Stakeholder influences on the project decrease over the life of the project. Hence, stakeholder influence is now less than in previous phases. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 549]

column2: Haitham is managing a software development project. The buyer of the product is an external entity. During the project?s execution, Haitham finds that a new operations manager was hired in the customer organization. The new manager is now a key stakeholder. Which of the following documents is least likely to be updated because of the addition of this new stakeholder?
column7: The stakeholder register must be updated since a new project stakeholder has joined the project. Changes to the stakeholder engagement plan might also be required to ensure that the new key stakeholder is properly engaged with the project. Addition of a new key stakeholder might bring some additional uncertainty to the project; this should be recorded in the risk register. The issue log is least likely to be updated in this case since no new issue has emerged. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 507]

column2: You are a certified PMP, and the PMI has contacted you as part of an investigation it is conducting into allegations of improper conduct by your manager, who is also a PMP. A complaint has been filed stating your manager has received bribes related to a large procurement contract on another project. PMI has asked whether you could provide information regarding this situation. What should you do?
column4: Send PMI project documentation and emails related to the allegations to assist with their investigation
column5: Do nothing, citing a conflict of interest
column7: Notifying the appropriate management of the PMI investigation and their request for your assistance is the best choice. Sharing confidential information with an outside party without approval from your management is a violation of the PMI Code of Ethics and Professional Conduct. Once the appropriate management have been notified, they will let you know the best way to proceed with this investigation. [PMI Code of Ethics and Professional Conduct] [Prof. Responsibility]

column2: Which of the following is not an example of parametric estimating?
column3: Activity duration estimated based on the number of drawings multiplied by the number of labor hours per drawing.
column4: Activity duration estimated based on the number of labor hours per meter for cable installation.
column5: Activity duration estimated based on the square footage in construction.
column6: Activity duration estimated based on the actual duration of a similar, previous project.
column7: Estimated activity duration based on the actual duration of a previous similar project is an instance of analogous estimating. The other three choices are examples of parametric estimating. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 200]

column2: A project charter that formally authorized a project was created. The project charter documented the initial requirements to satisfy stakeholders' needs and expectations. How often should the project charter be revised?
column3: At the beginning, middle, and end of a project
column6: Project charter is usually not updated during the course of the project.

column2: A project manager needed to shorten a project schedule and decided to employ crashing, a schedule compression technique. Which of the following activities would not be an example of crashing?
column7: Schedule compression techniques such as crashing and fast tracking shorten the project schedule without changing the project scope. Approving overtime, bringing in additional resources and paying to expedite delivery activities are valid examples of crashing. Reducing project scope is not a valid example of crashing. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 215]

column2: A project can be authorized by any of the following except:
column7: Projects are authorized by someone external to the project such as a project sponsor, project management office (PMO), or portfolio steering committee. A project manager does not authorize the project. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 77]

column2: A first-time project manager created a Work Breakdown Structure (WBS) where the deliverables had different levels of decomposition. What would your comment on this be?
column3: This is incorrect. All deliverables need to have the same level of decomposition.
column4: This is incorrect. Only deliverables under different branches can have different levels of decomposition.
column5: This is fine. The focus of the WBS is not the deliverables but the tasks involved.
column6: This is fine. Different deliverables can have different levels of decomposition, depending on the work involved.
column7: This is acceptable. Deliverables need not all have the same level of decomposition. This will depend on the work involved and degree of control required. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 158]

column2: Decision tree analysis is used to calculate the average outcome when the future includes scenarios that may or may not happen. What are a decision node?s inputs and outputs?
column3: Input: Cost of each decision; Output: Probability of occurrence
column4: Input: Scenario probability; Output: Expected Monetary Value (EMV)
column5: Input: Cost of each decision; Output: Payoff
column6: Input: Cost of each decision; Output: Decision made
column7: Decision tree analysis is used to calculate the average outcome when the future includes scenarios that may or may not happen. In a decision node, the input is the cost of each decision and the output is a decision made. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 435]

column2: Which of the following is neither an input nor an output of the Direct and Manage Project Work process?

column2: Which of the following is true about risks?
column3: A risk usually has a single cause and, if it occurs, may have one or more effects.
column4: A risk usually has a single cause and, if it occurs, usually has a single effect.
column5: A risk usually has more than one cause, and if it occurs, usually has a single effect.
column6: A risk may have one or more causes, and, if it occurs, may have one or more effects.
column7: A project risk is an uncertain event or condition whose occurrence may affect the objectives of the project. A risk may have one or many causes, and if it occurs, it may have one or more impacts. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 417]

column2: You have just taken over a project from another project manager about six months into a 12-month project. As you get to know the staff on the project, you become aware that five staff members are relatives of the previous project manager. What do you do?
column3: Check recruitment records of all employees
column4: Report the HR manager to PMI
column6: Notify your project stakeholders there is a possibility that nepotism was behind some of the staffing decisions made on your project
column7: Notify your project stakeholders of the situation. Once they are aware of the circumstances, a plan of action can be developed. It is possible the stakeholders may already be aware of the situation and had actually approved the hiring of these resources. Therefore, you should involve your stakeholders to resolve this issue. [PMI Code of Ethics and Professional Conduct] [Prof. Responsibility]

column2: The Actual Cost (AC) is the total cost actually incurred and recorded in accomplishing work performed for an activity or work breakdown structure component. What is the upper limit for the AC?

column4: The Actual Cost (AC) is limited to the Planned Value (PV)

column6: There is no upper limit for the Actual Cost (AC)

column2: You are preparing two documents for risk management. One contains sources of overall project risk and also summary information on individual risks. The second describes individual risks identified. What name should you give to the first document?
column7: The risk report presents the current level of overall risk exposure of the project that will inform the selection of the risk response strategy. The risk report may also list individual project risks in priority order and provide additional analysis of the distribution of individual project risks that may inform risk response selection. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 440]

column2: A project manager managing a project with extreme weather expected soon. The project is over budget, and the project sponsor can not provide additional funding. To achieve the milestone before the extreme weather begins, which of the following techniques should the project manager use?
column7: Because the project is over budget and the project sponsor can not provide additional funding, you can not use crashing in this case. The project manager should use Fast Tracking to achieve the milestone before the extreme weather begins. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 215]

column2: The total budget of a 12 month project is SAR 2 million. The project's first three months indicates a cost to date of SAR 500,000 and the earned value is SAR 525,000, and the total amount spent till now is SAR 550,000. What is the project status?
column3: Ahead of schedule and under budget.
column6: Ahead of schedule and over budget.
column7:
A cost to date (PV) = SAR 500,000
Earned value (EV) = SAR 525,000. 
Actual cost (AC) = SAR 550,000
CV = EV - AC = 525,000 - 550,000 = -25,000 (Negative)
PV = EV - PV = 525,000 - 500,000 =  25,000 (Positive) 
SO, the project is ahead of schedule and over budget
[PMBOK 6th edition Page 262]

column2: A project scope statement is defined with project deliverables, constraints, and assumptions associated with the project objectives. What should the project manager do next?
column3: Take a formal acceptance of the completed project deliverables.
column4: Monitoring the status of the project and product scope and managing changes to the scope baseline.
column5: Determine the products, services, and results to be delivered.
column6: Establish a hierarchical breakdown of the total scope to be carried out by the project team.
column7:
A project scope statement is defined, So, "Define scope" process is completed. Therefor the next process is "Create WBS". 
Create webs is the process of establish a hierarchical breakdown of the total scope to be carried out by the project team to comply with the project objectives. [PMBOK 6th edition Page 157]

column2: You are administering a contract on your project. Your sponsor asks you to give him the list of paid invoices to the seller. He wants a report containing information about the total amount collected by the seller as part of project execution. What documentation would you review in order to provide your sponsor with the report?
column7: Work Performance Data contain raw observations and measurements during activities performed to carry out the project work. Seller paid invoices are part of work performance data used as input to the "Control Procurements" process. You review, analyze, and integrate the seller invoice data into work performance information (for example total amount collected by the seller comparing to the planned amount), which you can then use to create the report requested by your sponsor. [PMBOK 6th edition Page 496]

column7: The business need and the cost-benefit analysis are contained in the business case to justify and establish boundaries for the project. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 77]

column2: You and your team have compiled your project's activity list, determined how the activities should be performed, and analyzed the schedule. You are preparing information for the project sponsor to highlight the identified activities that may create a delay in the overall project schedule. Which of the following would be most useful in this situation?
column7: In this question, project network diagrams would best serve to provide information concerning activities that would possibly create schedule delays. A project network diagram is one of three suggested project schedule models. At a minimum, a project schedule should include planned start dates and planned finished dates for each activity. Network diagrams which include activity date information and critical path activities, display has those activities logically relate to other activities and overall project timeline. A detailed network diagram that includes critical path activities, durations, milestones, and resources could be useful in this situation to highlight the activities that may create a delay in the overall project schedule. [PMBOK 6tha edition, Page 194]

column2: Ahmad is a project manager working for a construction company. As part of his current project, he oversees the inspection of deliverables, measuring them against documented requirements and acceptance criteria for obtaining the stakeholders' formal acceptance of the project deliverables. What project management process is he performing?
column7: Inspection activities such as measuring, examining and validating to determine whether work and deliverables meet requirements and product acceptance criteria is a tool used in "Validate Scope" process. Inspections are sometimes called reviews, product reviews, and walkthroughs. In some application areas, these different terms have unique and specific meanings. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 166]

column2: One of the project risks is likely to cause, a negative impact of SAR 15,000 with a probability of 50%. At the same time, there is a possibility of saving SAR 10,000 by choosing alternate resources, this has a likelihood of 25%. What is the Expected Monetary Value (EMV) of the project?
column7:
The Expected Monetary Value (EMV) of risks in the project is the sum of the probability multiplied by impact for each risk. Threats will have negative impact and opportunities will have positive impact. So, 
EMV = (Probability * Impact) for each Risk
= - (0.5*15,000) + (0.25*10,000) 
=  -5,000 SAR
[PMBOK 6th edition, Page 435]

column2: Rework is an example of?
column7:
The cost of quality (COQ) associated with a project consists of Prevention Costs, Appraisal Costs and Failure Costs (internal/external). Rework is an example of Internal Failure Costs. 
[PMBOK 6th edition, Page 282, 283]

column2: You are a project manager, and your project is currently in the execution phase. One of your project team member leave the site early at 3:00 pm Thursday and mistreats his colleagues. You would like to establish clear expectations regarding the acceptable behavior of the team member. To avoid such situations, you should create:
column7: The team charter establishes clear expectations regarding acceptable behavior by project team members. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 319]

column2: During a presentation to CEO you want to display the project schedule with only the key deliverables displayed. What is the best tool help you with this?
column7: Milestone chart used by senior management. A milestone chart displays only the key deliverables and is simple and easy to understand. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 218]

column2: At the beginning of the project, you and your team would like to address all the strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and threats the project is facing. What tool should be used?
column7: A SWOT Analysis would be the best choice. This technique examines the project from each of the strengths, weakness, opportunities, and threats perspectives. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 415]

column2: Which of the following items can be defined by creating the Cost Management Plan of a project?
column3: Level of accuracy and Work Packages
column4: Rules of Performance Measurement and Rewards
column5: Units of Measure and Quality Metrics
column6: Control Thresholds and Units of Measure
column7: A Cost Management Plan defined the Control Thresholds and Units of Measure. Control Thresholds are typically expressed as a percentage of deviation from the baseline. Units of Measure is defined as units used to measure the project cost. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 238]

column2: You are managing a complex project with many stakeholders each with their own interest in the project. You have begun the process of monitoring overall project stakeholder relationships. Your goal is to increase the efficiency and effectiveness of stakeholder engagement activity. What process are you are engaged in?
column7: Monitor Stakeholder Engagement is the process of monitoring project stakeholder relationships and tailoring strategies for engaging stakeholders through modification of engagement strategies and plans. The key benefit of this process is that it maintains or increases the efficiency and effectiveness of stakeholder engagement activities as the project evolves and its environment changes.  [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 530]

column2: Ali is a Project Manager of a project in which team members have a dual reporting structure. In addition to reporting to him, they also report to their functional manager. Also, the team members are expected to do the project work along with department work. Ali is working in which form of organization?
column7: These are the characteristics of a matrix organization where team members have dual reporting structure, and the teams work in their respective functional areas while performing project work. Tight matrix has nothing to do with organization structure, it simply denotes keeping the project team in the vicinity. [PMBOK 6th edition, page 47]

column2: A project manager is preparing a kick-off meeting for a new service assessment. A high-level description of the service has been provided. What should the project manager do next?
column5: Develop the responsible, accountable, consult, and inform (RACI) matrix.
column7: Since a high-level description of the service has been provided, it's mean the "Collect Requirements" process completed and the Project Manager need to start "Define Scope" process to get the project scope statement.  [PMBOK 6th edition, page 150]

column2: You have been assigned as a project manager of a new project to be executed out of Orlando. The project is being implemented in an area with many hurricanes. What is the best risk response strategy appropriate for this project?
column7: The best risk response strategy appropriate for this project, is to hire a third party to complete this work and shifting ownership of a threat to him to manage the risk and to bear the impact if the threat occurs. [PMBOK 6th edition, page 443]

column2: As a project manager, you are working on high rise building project. You are struggling to arrange your first meeting with project human resources. What should you do to ensure resource collaboration?
column4: Obtain Business case approval from the project sponsor
column7: The project charter is the document issued by the project initiator or sponsor that formally authorizes the existence of a project and provides the project manager with the authority to apply organizational resources to project activities. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 81]

column2: During half of the implementation phase, you notice that a competitor will release the same product into the marketplace. What should you do next?
column4: Advise the sponsor to cancel the project
column7: If a competitor will release the same product in the marketplace you must make a cost-benefit analysis to see you will continue in the project or cancel the project. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 105]

column2: You are a project manager managing an IT project. During project closure, customer agreement cannot be achieved through negotiations. What should the project manager do next?
column3: Unresolved claims may be subject to litigation
column6: Seek arbitration following the alternative dispute resolution ADR procedures
column7: Whenever settlement cannot be achieved through direct negotiation, some form of alternative dispute resolution (ADR) including mediation or arbitration may be explored. When all else fails, litigation in the courts is the least desirable option. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 498]

column2: You are over budget and it is impossible to complete the project with the given budget. Therefore, you submit a change request which your management approves. After approval, you update the cost baseline and update other project documents. The document used to register any changes occur during the project execution is known as:
column7: In the change log, you record all changes occurs during the project, along with its impact on any project objective. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page120 ]

column2: During a risk audit, it was found that some risks were not analyzed correctly. It was suspected that risk-related information were not properly reviewed before concluding characteristics of risks like probability, etc. What could have been done to prevent this issue?
column4: Effective interviews during the risk identification process
column7: Risk data and quality assessment is about validating the accuracy and reliability of risk-related information. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 423]

column2: You are a project manager who takes over a project during the execution phase. You would like to know more about project deliverables, the work required to complete those deliverables, project constraints, and assumptions. Which of the following documents would be MOST useful?
column7: The project manager should refer to the project scope statement as it captures all the details related to the project scope including the product acceptance criteria, scope description, project deliverables, constraints, and assumptions. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 154]

column2: A project manager notices an unusually high rate of risks, but has limited resources to address them. To what should the project manager refer to determine risk priorities?
column7: A probability and impact matrix is a grid for mapping the probability of each risk occurrence and its impact on project objectives if that risk occurs. This matrix specifies combinations of probability and impact that allow individual project risks to be divided into priority groups.  [PMBOK 6th edition, page 425]

column2: A detailed milestone list is created as an output of which process?
column7: A detailed milestone list is created as an output of the Define Activities process and includes information on whether the milestone is mandatory or optional. Note that the project charter also contains milestone information but at a higher level. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 186]

column2: You are the project manager for a large construction project. You want to understand the process for preparing a project scope statement and how formal acceptance of the completed project deliverables will be obtained. Which of the following will you have to reference?
column7: Scope management plan is a component of the project management plan that contains information and guidance on how the scope and the scope-related processes are to be managed. What is included varies, but should contain procedures and processes specifying how the formal acceptance of the completed project deliverables will be obtained. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 137]

column2: Which data representation techniques helps to categorize stakeholders and combine the grid elements into a three-dimensional model that can be useful to project managers and teams in identifying and engaging their stakeholder community and assists with the development of communication strategies?
column7: Stakeholder cube is a refinement of the grid models. This model combines the grid elements into a three-dimensional model that can be useful to project managers and teams in identifying and engaging their stakeholder community. It provides multiple dimensions that improve the depiction of the stakeholder community as a multidimensional entity and assists with the development of communication strategies. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 513]

[PMBOK ια γ΅ ι«§«΅ ? ι­ε¥΅ 513]

column2: You have been appointed as a project manager for a project which involves more than 2,000 stakeholders. One of the key stakeholders does not have authority regarding project decisions, but you recently discovered that he has much interest in your project. What stakeholder management strategy should you use with this key stakeholder?
column7:
A power/interest grid is a classification model used for stakeholder analysis and management that groups the stakeholders based on their level of authority (power) and their level of concern (interest) regarding project outcomes. The classification and recommended management strategies are as follows: 
Low-power/low-interest: monitor only 
Low-power/high-interest: keep informed 
High-power/low-interest: keep satisfied 
High-power/high-interest: manage closely 
Based on this scenario, the Key stakeholder can be classified as Low-power/high-interest. Therefore, the correct answer is to keep the key stakeholder informed. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 512]

column2: You have been asked by your project manager to help create a chart that illustrates the project resources that will be working on each work package. What would be the best type of chart to use?
column7: A RACI chart is used to illustrate the connections between work packages, or activities, and project team members. A RACI chart is a useful tool to use to ensure a clear assignment of roles and responsibilities when the team consists of internal and external resources. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 317]

column2: A project manager is running a complex transformation project. During a team briefing, the lead resource raises a concern that a critical milestone is being affected because tasks are taking longer than expected. What should the project manager do?
column3: Increase the number of resources to ensure that milestones are achieved
column4: Review the project management plan to identify how the estimates were built
column5: Inform the project sponsor of the expected delay and potential impact
column6: Identify corrective actions and raise the issue to the change control board CCB if needed
column7: Since the critical milestone is being affected because tasks are taking longer than expected. The project manager should Identify corrective actions and raise a change request to the change control board CCB if needed. Option (Increase the number of resources to ensure that milestones are achieved) is the next step after CCB approval. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 229]

column2: A senior project manager is working on monitoring the progress of the schedule. To determine whether performance is getting better or worse, he analyzes project performance over time. What technique is the project manager using?
column7: Trend analysis examines project performance over time to determine whether performance is improving or deteriorating. Graphical analysis techniques are valuable for understanding performance to date and for comparing to future performance goals in the form of completion dates. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 227]

column7: Process Analysis examines problems, constraints, and non-value added activities that occur during project work. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 292]

column2: You are in the process of analyzing the stakeholders on your project. You have grouped them based on their authority and their degree of active involvement in the project. Which of the following would you use to document this information?
column7: A Power/Influence Grid groups the stakeholders based on their authority and their degree of active involvement in the project.  [PMBOK 6th edition, Page, 512]

She also believes she needs to pay special attention to stakeholder management to ensure the success of this project. First, she needs to develop her stakeholder register. To produce the project stakeholder register, which of the following processes must Nada start?
column7: The stakeholder register is developed during the Identify Stakeholders process. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 514]

column2: During the implementation phase, one of your project team has told you that the Concrete delivery will be delayed one week. As a project manager, what document should you refer to FIRST?
column7: You should refer First to Risk Register to check this risk was identified before or not. If yes so this identified risk and you should implement the response. if it's not identified before then it's considered unidentified risk occurred and you should do workaround. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 449]

column2: Which of the following techniques should a project manager use to optimize and reduce the duration of a project?
column7: Fast tracking. A schedule compression technique in which activities or phases are normally done in sequence are performed in parallel for at least a portion of their duration. [PMBOK 6th edition page, 215]

column2: A project manager is executing a new office building. Which of the following activities might the project manager and the team conduct during the Monitor and Control Project Work process?
column3: Implementing approved change requests to achieve the project's objectives
column4: Transfer the ownership of deliverables to the assigned stakeholders
column5: Prepare and share the final project report according to the communications management plan
column6: Comparing actual project performance against the project management plan
column7: Monitor and Control Project Work is the process of tracking, reviewing, and reporting overall progress to meet the performance objectives defined in the project management plan. From the answers, only comparing actual project performance against the project management plan is performed during monitor and control project work process. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 105]

One of the inputs to this process is the project management plan which provides guidance regarding stakeholder communications, risk management, change management, and stakeholder engagement. Specifically, the stakeholder engagement plan contains information on how to manage stakeholder expectations this helping to determine how to engage the stakeholders effectively. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 523]

column2: A stakeholder requests a change to the project. The project manager wants to avoid wasting the change control board (CCB) time and decides to approve the change himself. What should the project manager do to make sure he can approve this change?

column4: Review the change with all stakeholders.
column5: Obtain the customer's approval before implementation.
column6: Verify that the change does not affect the project baseline.
column7:
Changes may or may not impact the project baselines. Sometimes only the performance against the baseline is affected. Decisions on those changes are usually made by
the project manager. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 117]

column2: A project manager has two projects of equal strategic importance. However, due to budget constraints, only one can be keep ongoing. There are uncertainties and risks associated with both projects. What tool or technique should the project manager use to decide which project to keep running?
column7: Decision trees analysis are used to support selection of the best of several alternative courses of action. Alternative paths through the project are shown in the decision tree using branches representing different decisions or events, each of which can have associated costs and related individual project risks (including both threats and opportunities). The end-points of branches in the decision tree represent the outcome from following that particular path, which can be negative or positive. The decision tree is evaluated by calculating the expected monetary value of each branch, allowing the optimal path to be selected. [PMBOK 6th edition page, 435]

column2: Team members on a life cycle replacement project are consumed to frequently changing requirements even without formal approval. What should the project manager do?

column4: Review the configuration management plan to identify what items will be changed and the frequency of the change
column5: Ask the project sponsor to provide directions to the project team with regard to the frequency of any changes to requirements
column6: Develop and implement a change management plan to define how changes will be addressed and controlled
column7: The change management plan is very important plan for every project because Its provide the direction for managing the change control process and documents the roles and responsibilities of the change control board (CCB). column2: A project manager is aware of a high risk item prior to starting a project. The project manager has completed a risk analysis and concluded that the risk is positive, high impact, and low probability. What should the project manager do?
column4: Conduct a strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and threats (SOWT) analysis
column6: Take action to capture the positive effect of uncertainty
column7: The project manager has completed identify risks and risk analysis process. The next process is plan risk responses which is the process of developing options, selecting strategies, and agreeing on actions to address overall project risk exposure, as well as to treat individual project risks. so the correct answer is (Take action to capture the positive effect of uncertainty). [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 437]

column2: During execution, a project manager identifies a major obstacle that is delay progress. An escalation to the client's project manager has gone unanswered, and project progress is worsening each week. What should the project manager do?
column3: Inform the supervisor of the client's project manager
column4: Follow the escalation matrix in the project management plan, and escalate it to the next level
column5: Escalate the issue directly to the steering committee
column7: Since (Escalation has gone unanswered), so its a communication issue and the project manager should revise the communication management plan because its contains the escalation processes with person or groups who will receive the information, methods or technologies used to convey the information, such as memos, email, press releases, or social media and method for updating and refining the communications management plan. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 377]
