column2: During a weekly status meeting, a team member informs the project manager that the design submitted to the local government for approval has been rejected due to an error in the blueprint. Resubmission of the design will require an additional two weeks. What should the project manager do first?
column3: Review the reject submission and begin working on the resubmission
column4: Add another layer of review for future projects to avoid similar problems
column5: Inform the project sponsor and look for support
column6: Update the issue log and identify the possible cause of the error
column7: Resubmission of the design will require an additional two weeks this Is an issue and the project manager should FIRST update the issue log and identify the possible cause of the error. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 96]

column2: A project to develop a new product contains many stakeholders who are trying to influence the project but have conflicting interests. The project manager has just completed the project charter and is working on the project management plan, which only gives a high-level view of both the product specifications and the project scope. What should the project manager do next to build a detailed scope description?
column3: List all concerns in the stakeholder engagement plan
column4: Create the work breakdown structure. WBS
column5: Develop the scope statement with stakeholder input.
column6: Implement the plan scope management process.
column7: The project manager has only completed the project charter and now is working on planning. So the first process in the planning is plan scope management, that helps in know how to collect requirement , how to build a detailed scope description, how to create WBS, and how formal acceptance of the completed project deliverables will be obtained. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 137]

column2: A global technology company invested in an infrastructure upgrade project as a part of its business strategy. During the planning phase, the project team works with stakeholders to identify project requirements. The project manager is having difficulty engaging stakeholders who work internationally in different time zones. The stakeholders are unable to participate in regularly scheduled planning meetings, and often don't provide timely responses to emails and other requests for information. What should the project manager do next to minimize the impact this issue may have on the project?
column3: Arrange a meeting to discuss the issue.
column7: The project manager is having difficulty engaging stakeholders who work internationally In different time zones and stakeholders are unable to participate in regularly scheduled planning meetings, so the project manager should create a communication management plan to minimize the impact this issue may have on the project. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 137]

column2: During the execution phase, a project manager discovers that team members have started to work on task that are coming directly from the customer. What should the project manager do?
column3: Split the project into two projects to keep the scopes separate and bill the client separately.
column4: Continue working on tasks that have already been started and revise the baseline
column5: Hold a risk review board meeting and add the tasks that have already been started to the risk log.
column6: Stop the work that is outside the project scope statement and submit a change request.
column7: The project manager should stop the work that is outside the project scope statement and submit a change request to take the approval from CCB, and only do the works included in the project scope statement or the approved change request. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 90]

column2: You are a project manager and have just assigned to the project in the execution phase. A project is in jeopardy. It is behind schedule and resources are limited. What is the first action you should take?
column7: When a project manager assign in the execution phase, the first action should be taken is Revise (Review) the project management plan. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 90]

column2: You are managing the changes made to the scope baseline. The causes of variances and the corrective action chosen should be included in:
column7: The lessons learned register could be updated with techniques that are efficient and effective in controlling scope, including causes of variances and corrective actions chosen. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 171]

column2: A project is behind schedule and over budget. As a result of increased stakeholder pressure, the project team has been placed under serious pressure. This causes a conflict between the quality and production managers, with each blaming the other for the delay and cost overruns. What should the project manager do?
column3: Meet with both managers, and ask them to immediately end the conflict to avoid negatively impacting the project.
column4: Meet with the managers' supervisors to discuss possible actions.
column5: Discuss the situation with the stakeholders, and follow their suggestions for dealing with the conflict.
column6: Refer to the team charter for guidelines on how to deal with this conflict.
column7: The team charter is a document that establishes the team values, agreements, and operating guidelines for the team. The team charter include Conflict( resolution process. SO the project manager should Refer to the team charter for guidelines on how to deal with this conflict. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 319]

column2: You are working with your team on estimating how much time each activity will take. One of the documents you are using contains information on categories of labor, material, and equipment required to complete your project. You are also interested to see skill levels of your labor, any certifications required, and grade levels your supplies. Which of the following documents would you primarily refer to for this purpose?
column7: The project team is performing the Estimate Activity Durations process. An input to this process is the Resource Breakdown Structure (RBS) which is a hierarchical list of team and physical resources related by category and resource type that is used for planning, managing. and controlling project work. Each descending level represents an increasingly detailed description of the resource until the information is a small enough to be used in conjunction with the WBS to allow the work to be planned, monitored, and controlled. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 198]

column2: Which of the following technique can be used to identify the key issues and suitable alternatives to be prioritized as a set of decisions for implementation?
column7: Prioritization matrix can be used to identify the key issues and suitable alternatives to be prioritized as a set of decisions for implementation. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 283]

column2: A project manager is currently developing the project schedule for a mandatory regulatory project. The project manager is receiving input from different stakeholders and finds that many of them are estimating completion times that are longer than the established end date. What should the project manager do next?
column3: Apply crashing to the project management plan in order to reduce the extension of the proposed schedule.
column4: Remind the stakeholders about the project constraints and request a revision of their inputs.
column5: Identify a new critical path that could guarantee the project's completion by the end date.
column6: Notify the sponsor and request to modify the end date to accommodate the proposed schedule.
column7: Since the stakeholders inputs will impact the established end date, the project manager should FIRST Notify the sponsor and request to modify the end date to accommodate the proposed schedule. The option (Remind the stakeholders about the project constraints and request a revision of their inputs) may be the next step if the project sponsor refuse to modify the end date. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 205]

column2: During the development of the scope management plan, a stakeholder requests the addition of pilot technology into the project scope to assist with the product marketing. What should the project manager do?
column3: Use the project reserve for the pilot technology.
column4: Review the scope baseline with the stakeholder.
column5: Increase the project budget with the cost of the pilot technology.
column6: Include the stakeholder in the scope planning meetings.
column7: The project manager should Include the stakeholder in the scope planning meetings. Note that meeting is one of the tools and techniques in the Plan Scope Management process to develop the Scope Management Plan. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 136]

column2: You are the project manager of a Construction project. The project sponsor has information about the project which is behind schedule and over budget, but he wants more details about the progress of the project. As a project manager, what should you provide to the project sponsor about the status of the project?
column7: Sponsor know that the project are behind schedule and over budget, so he knows Earned Value report, in this case the project manager should provide the sponsor with (Work performance report) because it includes status reports and progress reports. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 382]

column2: A project's primary focus is on schedule. To monitor this, the project manager requests monthly progress reports from the contractor. What should the project manager ask the contractor to include in these reports?
column7: The project manager should ask the contractor to include Gantt charts or also known as Bar charts in these reports because its represent schedule information where activities are listed on the vertical axis, dates are shown on the horizontal axis, and activity durations are shown as horizontal bars placed according to start and finish dates. Gantt or Bar charts are relatively easy to read and are commonly used. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 217]

column2: During the planning stage of a project, a company goes under an organizational structure change. The project manager believes most of the stakeholders have changed. Which tool or technique should the project manager uses to verify whether the stakeholders have changed?
column7: Questionnaires and surveys are a Data-gathering techniques that written sets of questions designed to quickly accumulate information from a large number of respondents. Questionnaires and/or surveys are most appropriate with varied audiences, when a quick turnaround is needed, when respondents are geographically dispersed, and where statistical analysis could be appropriate.S0 the project manager should uses Questionnaires and surveys to verify whether the stakeholders have changed. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 507]

column2: A project manager for a large, ongoing project is under a tight deadline to finish each of the project's three phases. The executives have decided to increase the budget and time to ensure their standards are met. The project manager has updated the schedule to reflect the increases. What should the project manager do next?
column3: Update the success criteria in the scope management plan.
column4: Review the requirements in the quality management plan.
column5: Add the tasks mentioned to the schedule management plan.
column6: Communicate the updated schedule to the stakeholder.
column7: The project manager has updated the schedule to reflect the new changes. The next step is communicate the updated schedule to the stakeholders. This is one of the change request steps. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 90]

column2: A stakeholder informs the project manager that they don't receive the weekly project status reports, even though they participated in the project kick-off meeting. What should the project manager do?
column3: Forward the latest report to this stakeholder.
column4: Adjust the stakeholder register to include this stakeholder
column5: Escalate this issue to the project sponsor.
column7: Since the stakeholder didn't receive the reports, the project manager should review the communication management plan because its contain the person or groups will receive the information, stakeholder communication requirements, reason for the distribution of that information, time-frame, and frequency for the distribution of required information. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 377]

column2: A project manager has completed his project on time and within budget. An unexpected complaint from a customer regarding the project's scope raised. It turns out that the customer wanted a much simpler solution. What should the project manager have done differently?
column3: Defined project scope with the customer.
column4: Controlled scope with the help of the project team.
column7: Since the project manager has almost completed a project, and the customer wanted a much simpler solution. This means that the project manager did not engage the customer as required and compiled all of his requirements. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 138]

column2: A pilot project is ready to close and the project team wants to capture the challenges that were overcome and the opportunities for future work. Where will they document this information?
column7: The lessons learned in the phase or project should be finalized before being entered into the lessons learned repository. The challenges that were overcome and the opportunities for future work should be documented in the lessons learned register before being entered into the lessons learned repository as a part of Organizational Process Assets updates. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 128]

column2: While browsing a local archive, a new project manager finds the previous project's lessons learned notes. They observe that the notes have not yet been stored in the project management information system PMIS. What should the project manager do with the notes?
column3: As the notes are already available, no further action is required.
column4: Store a local copy on their hard drive for future use.
column5: Disregard the notes since they are not in the PMIS.
column6: Ask the previous project manager to archive the notes in the PMIS.
column7: Since the previous project's lessons learned notes not yet been stored in the project management information system (PMIS). The project manager should ask the previous project manager to archive the notes in the PMIS. The option (As the notes are already available, no further action is required) not correct because this notes related to the previous project and should be archived. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 128]

column2: A project manager has been hired to develop a product for a multinational company. While writing the key deliverables for the project charter, the project manager has two technology options and is unsure of which to use. One is safer and the other is cheaper. What should the project manager do to determine the key deliverables for the project?
column3: Establish requirements with the project sponsor.
column4: Use the cheaper technology in order to maintain the budget.
column5: Choose the best option based on the project manager's experience.
column6: Meet with the client to understand their technological requirements.
column7: Refer to PMP exam content outline in Initiating (Task 02). Project Manager have to Identify key deliverables based on the business requirements in order to manage customer expectations and direct the achievement of project goals. So, the correct answer Is to meet with the client to understand their technological requirements. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 80]

column2: A recently appointed project manager is in constant conflict with a senior manager. Since this is not ideal for the team, the project manager wants to resolve this. What should the project manager do?
column3: Escalate the issue to the project sponsor.
column4: Seek guidance from the other project managers.
column5: Enlist the help of a neutral mediator.
column6: Request a scheduled face-to-face meetings with the senior manager.
column7: The project manager should request scheduled face-to-face meetings with the senior manager. This is an example of problem solving technique (The best Conflict Resolutions technique).  [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 356]

column2: During project execution, it is noticed that the actual expenditure is too high compared to baseline cost estimates. What should the project manager do next?
column3: Revisit project scope and cut high-cost items.
column4: Review historical data to get new cost estimates.
column5: Review assumption log to understand which cost assumptions were wrong.
column6: Update cost forecasts and discuss the options with the project sponsor.
column7: Because the actual expenditure is too high compared to baseline cost estimates, the project manager should update cost forecasts and discuss the options with the project sponsor.  [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 269]

column2: A project earned value = SAR 40,000 , Actual Cost = SAR 50,000 , and BAC = SAR 200,000. What is the Estimate To Complete (ETC) for the project if the work is performed at the budgeted rate?
column7:
The Formula used for EAC is 
EAC = AC + BAC - EV 
        = 50,000 + 200,000 - 40,000 = SAR 210,000
ETC = EAC - AC 
        = 210,000 - 50,000 = SAR 160,000
[PMBOK 6th edition, Page 267]

column2: A project manager wants to ensure sufficient stakeholder participation throughout a project's life cycle. What should the project manager include in the stakeholder engagement plan?
column3: Feedback from stakeholders on project operations.
column6: Desired and current stakeholder engagement levels.
column7: A stakeholder engagement assessment matrix supports comparison between the current engagement levels of stakeholders and the desired engagement levels required for successful project delivery. To  ensure sufficient stakeholder participation throughout a project's life cycle, the project manager should include the desired and current stakeholder engagement levels in the stakeholder engagement plan. [PMBOK 6th edition Page,521]

column2: A project manager joins a new project for an organization that does not have a lessons learned repository. How should the project manager establish the project baselines?
column3: Identify and map the benefits and outcomes of the project.
column4: Ask stakeholders to provide their recommendations for the project.
column5: Develop a business case to document project objectives.
column6: Perform a data gathering analysis and review the organizational process assets
column7: Since he is a new project manager, he should perform a data gathering analysis and review the organizational process assets to establish the project baseline. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 82]

column2: During a group activity to identify an input to the plan procurement management process, some participants disagree with the ranking of compliance-related items. What tool or technique should the project manager use to resolve this?
column7: Since some participants disagree with the ranking. Requirements documentation is an input of the plan procurement management process. One of the tools in the collect requirement process is Nominal Group Technique. This technique enhances brainstorming with a voting process used to rank the most useful ideas for further brainstorming or for prioritization. [PMBOK 6th edition page, 144]

column2: A project manager has just completed the project management plan for a construction project. This is a high-visibility project for many stakeholders across multiple functional departments and level of understanding. What can the project manager do to ensure approval of the project management plan?
column3: Develop a stakeholder register and then select the most important stakeholder to obtain their approval.
column4: Ask the project sponsor to approve the project management plan as a first step, then communicate this to other stakeholders to help approve the project .
column5: Conduct interviews with each stakeholders separately in order to obtain approval of the project management plan individually.
column6: Organize a meeting for stakeholders and provide the appropriate information to obtain their approval.
column7: Refer to PMP exam content outline in the planning (Task no. 11). Present the project management plan to the relevant stakeholders according to applicable policies and procedures in order to obtain approval to proceed with project execution. So the correct answer is: Organize a meeting for stakeholders and provide the appropriate information to obtain their approval. [PMBOK 6th edition page, 86]

column2: During project execution, a high-performing team member leaves. Following this loss, a planned quality audit is conducted that indicates the work product's quality standards are unmet. What should the project manager do next?

column6: Create a cause and effect diagram.
column7: The issue is not only related to the leaving of the team member. Since the work product's quality standards are unmet, the project manager should first create a cause and effect diagram to identify the root cause of the problem. [PMBOK 6th edition page, 288]

column2: A functional manager for the organization is also the direct supervisor for one of the team members on a current project. The functional manager requests that the project manager provide a weekly summary of the team member's work performance. The functional manager and the project manager are not in the same geographical area. What should the project manager do?
column3: Make a phone call at the end of the week to quickly debrief the functional manager on the tasks performed.
column4: Hold a weekly meeting with the functional manager to review the tasks performed.
column5: Deny the functional manager's request and escalate the situation to the steering committee.
column6: Draft a weekly email to the functional manager with a short list of the tasks performed.
column7: Since the functional manager and the project manager are not in the same geographical area, and the functional manager requests a weekly summary of the team member's work performance from PM. Therefore, FM not requested a phone call or a weekly meeting, and it's not good practice to deny the functional manager's request and escalate the situation to the steering committee. So the project manager should draft a weekly email to the functional manager with a short list of the tasks performed. [PMBOK 6th edition page, 379]

column7: Management Reserve used to fund unidentified risks when occurs, management reserves are intended to address the unknown-unknowns that can affect a project. While Contingency reserve used to fund identified risks when occurs. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 449]

column2: A project manager is meeting with the steering committee to obtain approval to deploy a develop software solution. column6: Review the communication management plan and present that all deliverables have been developed and are ready for deployment.
column7: Review the communication management plan and present that all deliverables have been developed and are ready for deployment. [PMBOK 6th edition page, 379]

column2: A project manager is managing a project to build a telecommunications tower. The project requires a crane, but the crane previously booked for this project receives a last-minute reassignment to a higher-priority government project. What should the project manager do first?
column3: Review the service agreement with the vendor.
column6: Add this to the issue log.
column7:
The first action to do by project manager is to add this issue to the issue log. Then prepare resolution for the situation. 
Hint: If the question ask "what is the best course of action", then the best answer is prepare resolution for the situation. [PMBOK 6th edition page, 358]

column2: During a project status meeting, a team member informs the project manager of an unexpected increase in the price of an essential component required to complete the deliverable. What should the project manager do?

column4: Refer to the procurement management plan.

column7: Analyze the impact of the price Increase on the project. [PMBOK 6th edition page, 257]

column2: While controlling project work, the team discovers that the schedule performance index (SPI) is 0.8 and the cost performance index (CPI) is 0.95 . If the schedule for this project is a priority and no additional resources are available, what should the project manager do?
column7: Since (The schedule is a priority & No additional resources are available & The schedule performance index (SPI) is .8 & the cost performance index (CPI) is .95). This mean that the project is behind schedule and over budget. So the project manager should use fast tracking as there is no additional resources are available to use crashing. [PMBOK 6th edition page, 215]

column2: A stakeholder refuses to accept delivery of a project that has passed the acceptance criteria, and provides a new set of acceptance criteria. What should the project manager do to enable project completion?
column3: Escalate the issue to the stakeholder's manager.
column4: Rework the project deliverables to meet the new acceptance criteria.
column5: Execute the change control process to accommodate the new acceptance criteria.
column6: Negotiate with the stakeholder to accept the project in its current state.
column7: Since the deliverable of the project has passed the acceptance criteria, therefore the project manager should first negotiate with the stakeholder to accept the project in its current state within the existing acceptance criteria before any change or escalation. [PMBOK 6th edition page, 163]

column2: A project task involves the procurement of a specific raw materials at regular intervals. Price fluctuations was identified as a risk during planning. The risk response is to exploit a price drop if it occurs. The price of the raw material has now reduced drastically. What should the project manager do?
column3: Purchase the raw material at the existing price.
column4: Wait for the prices to further reduce.
column6: Review the risk register for the recommended responses.
column7: The risk response is to exploit a price drop if it occurs, now the raw material has reduced drastically. So the project manager should review the response strategy that included in the risk register to exploit the opportunity. [PMBOK 6th edition page, 449]

column2: A project manager is managing a project with a major deliverable that failed its final acceptance test. The project is now behind schedule and over budget because a replacement must be created. What process should the project manager use to determine why the failure occurred?
column7: Root cause analysis is an analytical technique used to determine the basic underlying reason that causes a variance, defect, or risk. A root cause may underlie more than one variance, defect, or risk. It may also be used as a technique for identifying root causes of a problem and solving them. When all root causes for a problem are removed, the problem does not recur. [PMBOK 6th edition page, 288]

column2: A lead business analyst on a large project has consistently been working late to finalize requirements for the next sprint. In the weekly team lead meeting. The project manager learns there are several business analysts on the team who have free cycles. What should the project manager do to ensure an even workload?
column3: Delay the start date of the next sprint to allow more time for gathering requirements.
column4: Review the list of open requirements and reassign them to team members with free cycles.
column5: Direct the business analysts with free cycles to take more ownership of the project.
column6: Facilitate a discussion within the team to redistribute the work within the project team.
column7: Since there are several business analysts on the team who have tree cycles, the  project manager should facilitate a discussion within the team to redistribute the work within the project team.  [PMBOK 6th edition page, 345]

column2: A project manager is gathering formal project requirements. After conducting stakeholder interviews, the project manager realizes that some objectives are inconsistent with those in the project charter. Based on information learned during the initiation phase, this project must be highly focused to stay within budget limits. To manage requirements and meet stakeholder expectations, what should the project manager do?
column3: Disregard stakeholders' objectives that may be outside the scope detailed in the project charter.
column4: Expand the project charter to include the newly identified objectives.
column5: Remove objectives in the project charter that are not aligned with the stakeholders' objectives.
column6: Realign the stakeholders' expectations with the objectives in the project charter.
column7: Since some objectives are inconsistent with those in the project charter, the project manager should realign the stakeholders' expectations with the objectives in the project charter to manage requirements and meet stakeholder expectations.  [PMBOK 6th edition page, 138]

column2: A project manager has just been assigned in the middle of the execution phase. The project is delayed and two important stakeholders are not cooperating with project objectives. Documentation states not to interact directly with either stakeholder, leaving this role to the company's chief information officer . What should the project manager do?
column3: Perform a root cause analysis and escalate to the two important stakeholders.
column4: Perform a data analysis and review the stakeholders' roles and responsibilities matrix.
column5: Perform a stakeholder analysis and escalate the issue to upper management.
column6: Perform an assumption and constraint analysis and review the stakeholder engagement plan.
column7: Analysis of current assumptions and constraints may be conducted in order to tailor appropriate engagement strategies. Review The stakeholder engagement plan that identifies the strategies and actions required to promote productive involvement of stakeholders in decision making and execution. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 521]

column2: A client approaches a design team member requesting that a current task be stopped and a new concept be developed. column4: Accept the request and make the changes.
column5: Ask the client to refrain from directly contacting team members.
column6: Refer to the perform integrated change control process.

column2: As a project manager in a communication project. The project is ahead of schedule and under budget. The sponsor then suggests a change to include a value-added feature that wouldn't impact project schedule and cost. What should you do next?

column7: The change does not impact the schedule and cost but the project manager should Evaluate the change's impact with the team on other project constraints... [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.117]

column2: To improve the quality of project deliverables, you decides to involve the project team in defining project standards, policies, and guidelines. The team thinks that this a waste of effort, and would like to continue to execute the project as planned. What should you do next?
column3: Produce the quality management plan, and distribute it to stakeholders.
column4: Meet with individual team members, and force them to comply.
column5: Log an issue with the team and discuss it with the human resources department.
column6: Organize a project team meeting to create a shared vision.
column7: The project manager should Organize a project team meeting to create a shared vision and the importance of the quality of the project deliverable and this is not a waste of effort and should defining project standards, policies, and guidelines To improve the quality of the project deliverables. The next step Produce the quality management plan, and distribute it to stakeholders. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.286]

column2: The Company CEO is asking you to make a presentation on your project, which has been in progress for 18 months to over 50 identified internal and external stakeholders. You have been conducting such presentations and holding meetings regularly on this critical project. You should begin by?
column3: Deciding on the general form of the presentation

column2: A resources can't be retained for the full project life cycle and there is no additional budget available. What should the project manager do to ensure effective project delivery while utilizing resources within budgeted limits?
column3: Move budgeted funds from other project areas to mitigate any risk of gaps in assignments.
column4: Create a budget change request for stakeholders before presenting project progress.
column5: Identify those resources who can likely perform all necessary project tasks, and remove resources that are specialized.
column6: Schedule similar tasks around the same time to limit the duration of resources' engagement.
column7: Because of the resources can't be retained for the full project life cycle and there is no additional budget available, the project manager should Schedule similar tasks around the same time to limit the duration of resources' engagement to ensure effective project delivery within budgeted limits. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.211]

column2: You work for Yory's, a food equipment manufacturer. Your organization is installing some new manufacturing equipment, and you are managing the project. Your project sponsor has asked for an EAC and has told you that he wants you to use ETC work considering CPI and SPI factors. If EV = 145, PV = 162, AC = 148, and BAC = 200, what is EAC?
column7: The EAC formula for this question is Ac + [(BAC - EV) ? (CPI x SPI)]. First, calculate CPI, which is EV ? AC: therefore, $145 ? $148 = .$98. SP) is EV ? PV; therefore, $145 ? $162 = .$90. Plugging in the numbers from the question, you get $148 + [($200 - $14S) (.898 x .890)] $210. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.265]

column2: John the project manager, discovers a significant flaw in a major project deliverable. Which project management process is being performed?
column7: Keyword ( project deliverable ) The control Quality process is performed to measure the completeness, compliance, and fitness for use of a product or service prior to user acceptance and final delivery. This is done by measuring all steps, attributes, and variables used to verify conformance or compliance to the specifications stated during the planning stage. Deliverables that are output from the Direct and Manage Project Work process are inspected in the Control Quality process. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 301]

column2: Why is it necessary to manage changes to the project by following the change management plan, while monitoring and controlling the projects, ?
column6: To align project goals with business needs

column2: A long term project for a company that is increasing its infrastructure is running . In month 13 of the project, the client escalates an issue that an expected delivery from a contracted third-party vendor wasn't received. Upon investigation, the project manager discovers that the vendor was unaware of this. Where should the project manager verify the delivery schedule?
column7: A milestone is a significant point or event in a project. A milestone list identifies all project milestones and indicates whether the milestone is mandatory, such as those required by contract, or optional, such as those based on historical information. Milestones have zero duration because they represent a significant point or event. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 186]

column2: In the middle of the design phase of a software development project, the project manager realizes that planned tasks will be delivered late. What should the project manager do first?
column3: Revise the task delivery dates in the project management plan.
column4: Assume the delay, and report it during the next stakeholder meeting.

column7: It's an issue and the project manager should Update the issue log. The issue log will help the project manager effectively track and manage issues, ensuring that they are investigated and resolved. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 96]

column2: Jessy, a project team member identifies a simple change that will improve product quality without impacting the project budget. What should you do as the project manager?

column2: You are a project manager in the telecom project for your organization. Due to the lateness of workers' payments, the workers made a strike, causing delays in an important component delivery. What could have been done differently to prevent this type of situation?
column7: Keyword ( strike ) What-if scenario analysis is the process of evaluating scenarios to predict their effect, positive or negative, on project objectives. A schedule network analysis is performed using the schedule to compute the different scenarios, such as delaying a major component delivery, extending specific engineering durations, or introducing external factors, such as a strike or a change in the permit process. The outcome of the what-if scenario analysis can be used to assess the feasibility of the project schedule under different conditions, and in preparing schedule reserves and response plans to address the impact of unexpected situations. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 213]

column2: You are a project manager for a company that provides catering services for events, each of which is managed as a project. The company is awarded a contract to cater a conference for 1,500 participants. The conference organizer conducts an inspection of the delivered food and beverages and discovers that 10 out of 10.000 soft drink bottles were out of date. Based on that, the conference organizer rejects the entire delivery. The project manager's company is now faced with replacement costs, the loss of credibility, and disrupted logistics. To what cost of quality (COQ) category do these costs belong?
column7:
Failure costs (internal/external). Costs related to nonconformance of the products, deliverables, or services to
the needs or expectations of the stakeholders. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.282]

column2: Markus is working on an international project which involves 150 team members and the project budget is $1,400,000. The weekly status meeting is conducted worldwide and is scheduled for Wednesday at 5:00 PM and the duration of the meeting is two hours. All of the team members globally communicate using the video conferencing unit at their location. What kind of communication method is this?
column7: Interactive communication is the most efficient way to ensure a common understanding by all participants on specified topics and is performed between two or more parties performing a multidirectional exchange of information. It includes meetings, phone calls, video conferencing to name a few. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.372]

column2: Ann is a member of a software team, she identified a potential nonconformance in some recently developed software The person who wrote the software disagrees. How should the project manager respond?

column4: Ask the member who discovered the problem to rectify it urgently so it is available in the next release.
column5: Record the disagreement for discussion at the next retrospective.
column6: Bring both resources together to discuss and resolve the issue immediately.
column7: Bring both resources together to discuss and resolve the issue immediately. This is an example of the solve problem technique... [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.349]

column2: You are working in a matrix organization. A team members indicate that they are also assigned to work on other initiatives and can no longer devote any time to their assigned activities. As a project manager, what should you do first to resolve this issue?
column3: Evaluate the impact and use optimizations techniques to compensate for the delay.
column4: Escalate the problem to the sponsor who can assign more staff to work on the project.
column5: Implement the change control process and reduce the project scope to include less deliverables.
column6: Speak to the functional manager and determine alternatives to address these activities.
column7: Since the team members assigned to work on other initiatives and can no longer devote any time to their assigned activities. The project manager should Speak to the functional manager and determine alternatives to address these activities. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.332]

column2: Sara is a project manager for a small project periodically engages resources for tasks in the project management plan. However, due to current budget, the resources can't be retained for the full project life cycle. According to project stakeholders, there is no additional budget available, so Sara must carefully plan how resources will be used to execute the project. What should Sara do to ensure effective project delivery while utilizing resources within budgeted limits?
column3: Move budgeted funds from other project areas to mitigate any risk of gaps in assignments.
column4: Create a budget change request for stakeholders before presenting project progress.
column5: Identify those resources who can likely perform all necessary project tasks, and remove resources that are specialized.
column6: Schedule similar tasks around the same time to limit the duration of resources' engagement.
column7:
Resource leveling can be used when
shared or critically required resources are available only at certain times or in limited quantities, or are over allocated,
such as when a resource has been assigned to two or more activities during the same time period (as
shown in Figure 6-17), or there is a need to keep resource usage at a constant level. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.211]

column2: A quality control member informs a you about a one-week schedule delay to complete the testing phase. What should you do next?
column4: Negotiate with the customer for a change in the schedule.
column5: Take corrective action to minimize the impact of delay
column6: Check whether this task is on the critical path.
column7: Before you take corrective measures, determine the impact of the delay. For example, if the task has 3 weeks float, you do not need other options. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.210]

column2: A project is terminated early, and you sends the final project report to relevant stakeholders. A senior manager is interested in understanding the impact and requests a copy of the report. What should you do?
column3: Send the report to the finance manager.
column4: Don't send the report since the project was prematurely terminated.
column5: Review the stakeholder engagement plan and act accordingly.
column6: Check the communication management plan and act accordingly.
column7: The project manager should Check the communication management plan and act accordingly because it contains Stakeholder communication requirements and Persons or groups who will receive the information. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 377]

column2: Which of the following analysis techniques is recommended when you need to analyze project stakeholders based on their power, urgency, and legitimacy and usefulness for large complex communities of stakeholders or where there are complex networks of relationships within the community?
column7: Salience model. Describes classes of stakeholders based on assessments of their power (level of authority or ability to influence the outcomes of the project), urgency (need for immediate attention, either time-constrained or relating to the stakeholders' high stake in the outcome), and legitimacy (their involvement is appropriate). There is an adaptation of the salience model that substitutes proximity for legitimacy (applying to the team and measuring their level of involvement with the work of the project). The salience model is useful for large complex communities of stakeholders or where there are complex networks of relationships within the community. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 513]

column7: The project business case is a documented economic feasibility study used to establish the validity of the benefits of a selected component lacking sufficient definition and that is used as a basis for the authorization of further project management activities.... column2: The customer rejects some type of deliverables, although many of the requirements are met. What should the project manager have done to avoid this?
column5: Requested more resources for quality control activity
column7: The root cause of this problem is the lack of resources. SO this is related to manage quality .. so the project manager should have ensured that quality was managed correctly to prevent this issue. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.288]

column4: Hire more people for the critical path.
column7: To address this situation, the project manager should Make changes to the original plan but FIRST he should Prepare a change request then analyze the impact on project constraints and get approval by CCB [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.96]

column2: You are managing a process improvement project for your company. You need to analyze over 20 of the company's processes to identify weaknesses and give your recommendations for improvement. Which of the following techniques can you use to analyze these processes?
column7: Process analysis. Process analysis identifies opportunities for process improvements. This analysis also examines problems, constraints, and non-value-added activities that occur during a process. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.292]

column2: As a project manager for your company, two team members come to you with a dispute regarding who will perform and report the status of a particular task. To resolve the conflict, which document will you refer to?
column6: Responsible, accountable, consult, and inform (RACI) matrix.
column7: Assignment Matrix (RAM) or (RACI) matrix , shows the connection between work packages or activities and team members. RAM Matrix can be used to define the responsibilities of groups or any individual team member. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 317]

column2: In a project to develop a new product, The project has fallen behind schedule because team members are lacking motivation. What should the project manager do to motivate the project team?
column7: The team members are lacking motivation. SO the best thing should the project manager do to motivate them is to Offer recognition and rewards. People are motivated when they feel they are valued in the organization and this value is demonstrated by the rewards given to them. Generally, money is viewed as a tangible aspect of any reward system, but intangible rewards could be equally or even more effective. Most project team members are motivated by an opportunity to grow, accomplish, be appreciated, and apply their professional skills to meet new challenges. A good strategy for project managers is to give the team recognition throughout the life cycle of the project rather than waiting until the project is completed. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 342]

column2: Mayra is a project manager who is deep into project execution. Currently, she is looking for information about the quality management issues that have been escalated by the team, as well as recommendations for process, project, and product improvements. What should she do?
column7: According to the scenario, he is looking for information about the quality management issues that have been escalated by the team as well as recommendations for process, project, and product improvements. This is the description of a quality report. Quality reports are an output of the Manage Quality process and include information that can be used by other processes and departments to take corrective actions in order to achieve the project quality objectives. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 296]

column2: During regular team meetings, you notices that there are clear signs of conflict and issues related to unclear task assignments and ownership. What should you as a project manager do to address this?
column3: Change the structure of the regular project meetings to improve communication.
column4: Investigate possible ways to improve team collaboration and morale.
column5: Meet individually with team members to understand the conflicts and issues.
column6: Define and obtain agreement on a responsible accountable, consult, and inform RACI Matrix.
column7: A RACI Matrix is a useful tool to use to ensure clear assignment of roles and responsibilities when the team consists of internal and external resources. SO the project manager should Define and obtain agreement on a responsible accountable, consult, and inform RACI Matrix to address this situation. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.317]

column2: Jessi is the project manager for a mobile application development project. At the end of the project kick-off meeting, what is the next phase?
column7: Explanation The project kick-off meeting is usually associated with the end of planning, so the next phase is Executing. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 86]

column2: Now, you wish to track the performance of individual members and optimize the team's performance. After  you have completed resource planning and acquired resources and improved the team competency and performance. Which process will you perform?
column7: All this is performed in the Manage Team process. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.345]

column2: Midway of your project and working on a deliverable which is 90% completed. It is time for the yearly audit. A team of auditors are about to come and verify if you are following the process as defined or not. However, as the deliverable is about to be completed, you check it and measure all dimensions to find any possible dimensional defects. What process is this?
column7: In the quality control process, you inspect the deliverable for any possible defects. As you are doing an inspection, you are in the quality control process. Please note that although the quality audit is performed in the manage quality process, it has not started yet and you are doing an inspection, which is a tool of the quality control process. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 303]

column2: Mustafa is a project manager of the civil project for your organization. In this project, you are currently performing quantitative risk analysis. The tool and technique you are using is a simulation where the project model is computed many times with the input values chosen at random for each iteration and Outputs representing the range of possible outcomes for the project. The goal is to create a probability distribution from the iterations for the project schedule. What technique will you use with this simulation?
column7:
Quantitative risk analysis uses a model that simulates the combined effects of individual project risks
and other sources of uncertainty to evaluate their potential impact on achieving project objectives. Simulations
are typically performed using a Monte Carlo analysis. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.433]

column2: Lisa has only a short timeframe in which to complete a project's cost estimation. What estimating technique should Lisa use?
column7: Analogous cost estimating uses values, or attributes, of a previous project that are similar to the current project. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.244]

column2: You are estimating the number of work periods needed to complete individual activities with estimated resources. One of the documents you are using contains information on categories of labor, material, and equipment required to complete your project. What is this document known as:
column7: Based on the scenario described, the project team is performing the Estimate Activity Durations process. An input to this process is the resource breakdown structure (RBS) which is a hierarchical list of team and physical resources related by category and resource type that is used for planning, managing, and controlling project work. Each descending level represents an increasingly detailed description of the resource until the information is small enough to be used in conjunction with the WBS to allow the work to be planned, monitored, and controlled. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 198]

column2: The sponsor complains about the quality of some deliverables. The project manager believes that these deliverables meet the project's quality standards. What tool or technique should the project manager use to support this?
column7: Control charts are used to determine whether or not a process is stable or has predictable performance. Upper and lower specification limits are based on the requirements and reflect the maximum and minimum values allowed. The control limits are determined using standard statistical calculations and principles to ultimately establish the natural capability for a stable process... Control chart shows upper and lower limits of the product quality which have been defined based on the quality management plan and those limits will show if the product within or without the quality predefined standards.. this will support PM believes the product match the quality standard... SO the Control charts is the correct answer. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 304]

column2: Suzi is a new project manager on a project with a very tight budget, she is struggling as they have no experience working on this type of project. What can the project manager do to mitigate the lack of experience?

column7: The organization did not have experience. So options ( Review the lessons learned repository of similar projects. and Ask for support from more senior project managers ) not correct ... column2: You are managing very critical project, some groups of stakeholders appear to have low product expectations. As a result, they are not performing as expected. This may put project objectives at risk . What should the you as a project manager do?
column3: Ask the project sponsor to intervene and motivate the underperforming stakeholders.
column4: Speak with the problematic stakeholders to increase their performance.
column7: The stakeholder engagement plan is a component of the project management plan that identifies the strategies and actions required to promote the productive involvement of stakeholders in decision making and execution. It can be formal or informal and highly detailed or broadly framed, based on the needs of the project and the expectations of stakeholders. The stakeholder engagement plan may include but is not limited to specific strategies or approaches for engaging with individuals or groups of stakeholders. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 522]

column2: The customer insist on using an alternative execution methodology, which is expected to increase project costs. What should the project manager do?
column3: Explain to the stakeholders why the execution methodology cannot be changed.
column4: Ignore the request, and continue with the planned execution methodology.
column5: Assess the stakeholder's methodology see if their expectations can be met.
column6: Escalate the potential methodology change to the project sponsor for approval.
column7: The Best answer is Escalate the potential methodology change to the project sponsor for approval. Option ( Ignore the request ) not good practice to Ignore the important Stakeholder requests. Option ( Explain to the stakeholders why the execution methodology cannot be changed ) Not correct because you should first ask the sponsor for approval he have the authority to decide the implementation of methodology. Option ( Assess the stakeholder's methodology see if their expectations can be met. ) Not Correct because this is a request from important stakeholder not from others. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.442]

column2: A project manager needed to monitor the technical performance of the project and capture data related to how many errors or defects had been identified and how many remained uncorrected. Which of the following techniques should he use?
column7: Histograms show a graphical representation of numerical data. Histograms can display the number of defects per deliverable, a ranking of the cause of defects, the number of times each process is noncompliant, or other representations of project or product defects. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 293]

column7: A stakeholder engagement assessment matrix supports the comparison between the current engagement levels of stakeholders and the desired engagement levels required for successful project delivery. column2: Tom is a project manager joins a project with cross-functional stakeholders and a fixed go-live date. He wants to quickly gather requirements and ensure all stakeholders are aligned so that any conflicts are flagged as early as possible. What should Tom do?
column3: Send a questionnaire to all stakeholders.
column4: Conduct individual interviews with each stakeholder.
column5: Set up job-shadowing sessions for all stakeholders.
column6: Use facilitation techniques with all stakeholders.
column7: Facilitation is used with focused sessions that bring key stakeholders together to define product requirements. Workshops can be used to quickly define cross-functional requirements and reconcile stakeholder differences. Because of their interactive group nature, well-facilitated sessions can build trust, foster relationships, and improve communication among the participants, which can lead to increased stakeholder consensus. In addition, issues can be discovered earlier and resolved more quickly than in individual sessions. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 145]

column2: Robin is a project manager on a large civil project. Robin had originally planned to use both of the company's tower crane simultaneously for a project but has just learned that one of them will be unavailable. Robin adjusts the schedule so that the components are created sequentially using the one remaining tower crane. Unfortunately, this action affects the critical path and delays the planned finish date of the project. Which of the following techniques has been used by Robin in this situation?
column7: Resource leveling is a resource optimization technique in which start and finish dates are adjusted based on resource constraints with the goal of balancing the demand for the resources with the available supply. Resource leveling can often cause the original critical path to change which is what happened in the scenario described. Adjusting the schedule to accommodate the loss of one of the tower crane is an example of resource leveling. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 211]

column2: In a project with a tight time frame, the project manager needs continuous stakeholder buy-in and input to avoid errors. Inevitably, changes occur as the project progresses. What should the project manager do?

column7: Monitor and update stakeholder relationships and tailor strategies for engaging stakeholders through changes to gain continuous stakeholder buy-in and input to avoid errors. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.530]

column2: You are a project manager. One of your team members identifies a risk for which new requirements may be needed for a project. This risk has a high impact but a low chance of occurrence. As a project manager, what should you do?

column7: Root cause analysis is Data analysis techniques used in identify risk process .typically used to discover the underlying causes that lead to a problem and develop preventive action. column2: A large, publicly funded civil project regulatory requirements specify that the contractor's project work be visually monitored on a continuous basis. Which method is suitable for meeting this compliance obligation'?
column5: Photographs attached to documentation submitted on a weekly basis
column6: Video feedback through onsite web cameras
column7: Publicly funded projects are under increasing scrutiny. A trend in infrastructure and commercial construction projects is the use of technology including web cameras (webcams) to improve stakeholder communications and relations. During construction, one or more webcams are installed on the site, with periodic updates to a publicly available website. The progress on the project can be viewed on the Internet by all stakeholders. Video data can also be stored, allowing analysis if a claim arises. Some projects have discovered that the use of webcams minimizes disputes relating to the construction work on site, as the webcam has recorded the events, so there should be no disagreement about the facts of the matter. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 464]

column2: Tom is in the executing phase of his project and stakeholders are escalating issues to management directly without involving him. Which of the following would have prevented this from happening if well documented and communicated?
column7: The Communications Management Plan contains information about the escalation process. This process describes how and when to escalate issues. This process has to be defined and also adequately explained and communicated to stakeholders, so you an have an effective escalation process. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.377]

column5: Create the work breakdown structure. WBS

column2: Your CEO asked you what the Estimate at Completion (EAC) will be for a small project you are working on. You were given a budget of $30,000, and to date, you have spent $20,000 but only completed $10,000 worth of work. You are sure the future work will be accomplished at the planned rate. What is the EAC?
column4: $60,000 as CPI is expected to be the same
column5: $10,000 as CPI is expected to be the same
column7:
If the future work will be accomplished at the planned rate, that the Estimate at Completion (EAC) will be AC + BAC - EV. 
Budget at Completion (BAC) is $30,000, Earned Value (EV) is $10,000, and Actual Cost (AC) is $20,000. Hence, the EAC is $40,000. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 267]

column2: You have been hired as a project manager for a new project. After several weeks, you discover that the accounting department has declined all charges because the project was not approved. What should the project manager have done to prevent this?
column3: Planned the resources necessary to start the project
column4: Verified that the business case was authorized by the project initiator
column5: Obtained the fund needed to start the project
column6: Obtained the project charter approval from the project sponsor
column7: The sponsor or initiator of the project Is responsible to establish (approve and issue) the charter and can take the help of the prospect project manager to develop it. The project manager should obtain the project charter approval from the project sponsor because the project charter is a document that formally authorizes the existence of a project al d provides the project manager with the authority to apply organizational resources to project activities. [PMBOK 6th edition page, 75]

column2: During a review meeting, you observe that one team member performed tasks beyond the scope of work. What should you as the project manager do?
column3: Crash the project to accommodate the additional scope that was performed.
column4: Advice the team member to keep all work within project scope.
column5: Inform the client of additional cost implications due to the extra work completed.
column6: Review the impact on the baseline and initiate changes control procedures.
column7: The project manager should Review the impact on the baseline and initiate changes control procedures. Option ( Advice the team member to keep all work within project scope. ) not enough because the out of scope tasks have already performed. Option ( Crash the project to accommodate the additional scope that was performed. ) Not correct because This means that the project manager agrees to carry out the tasks without requesting a change and this not good practice. Option ( Inform the client of additional cost implications due to the extra work completed. ) will be done by the CCB. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.113]

column2: Michel is managing a project. The project is about three-fourths done when the site engineer reports that due to inherent complexities in a specific task, the deliverables would be delayed. You and the site engineer have analyzed the impact of this change to cost, and have written up a change request and requested approval from the change control board. Just today, you have received approval from the change control board - what should be the immediate course of action?
column4: Ascertain the impact of this change to scope, schedule and cost before making any change
column6: Make sure that the scope baseline and schedule baseline are updated to reflect the approved change before implementing the change.

Direct and Manage Project Work is the process of leading and performing the work defined in the project management
plan and implementing approved changes to achieve the project?s objectives. The key benefit of this process is that it
provides overall management of the project work and deliverables, thus improving the probability of project success. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.90]

column2: A recently promoted project manager must mange the weekly status update meeting. What should the project manager do to ensure a productive meeting?

column4: Avoid or smooth over any disagreements
column5: Carefully read the latest meeting minutes
column6: Circulate a defined agenda in advance
column7: Meeting management is taking steps to ensure meetings meet their intended objectives effectively and efficiently. The following steps should be used for meeting planning: " Prepare and distribute the agenda stating the objectives of the meeting. "? Ensure that the meetings start and finish at the published time. Ensure the appropriate participants are invited and attend. " Stay on topic. " Manage expectations, issues, and conflicts during the meeting. " Record all actions and those who have been allocated the responsibility for completing the action. [PMBOK 6th edition page, 386]

column2: A security team notifies you of a change in security procedures. you use the change control process to update the project management plan. After seeing the change, a stakeholder complains that it was unnecessary because the project is almost complete. What should you as the project manager do?
column3: Create a change request to reverse the change until a consensus is reached.
column4: Add a risk to the risk register to track the impact of stakeholder disagreement.
column5: Ignore the stakeholder's concern and follow the new procedures.
column6: Convince the stakeholder of the benefits resulting from the change.
column7: The project manager with the team member have evaluated the impact of this change on project constraints and then approved by the CCB. SO he should Convince the stakeholder of the benefits resulting from the change. Option ( Create a change request to reverse the change until a consensus is reached. ) not good because the change already approved after the consensus of CCB. Option ( Ignore the stakeholder's concern and follow the new procedures. ) not good practice to ignore the stakeholder's requests. Option ( Add a risk to the risk register to track the impact of stakeholder disagreement.) Not correct because this not a risk and the change has been approved. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.530]

column2: You are working as a research studying the growth of bacteria under different environmental conditions. Based on your experiments, you conclude that the immortality of bacteria increases as the temperature increases. What type of diagram can you use to illustrate your observation?

column2: John finds that a specific work package was not delivered on time and will be delayed by an additional three weeks. He worries that this might impact project completion. What should John do first?

column4: Adjust the Gantt chart for the work package.
column5: Use schedule compression to get the project back on track.
column6: Calculate the amount of total float for the work package.
column7: The work package will he delayed by an additional three weeks and may be have a float 4 weeks of more. column2: You are a Project manager developing the project charter. Which of the Following are you using in this Process?
column7: Agreements are used to define initial intentions for a project. column2: You are managing a project which will provide web- base solutions to your customer. The requirements of this project are not clearly defined in the beginning and there will be modifications based on customer feedback as the project evolves. You plan as much as you can and work based on that. You continue the planning as you learn more about the project. Which techniques will be most helpful to define activities on the project?
column7: Rolling wave planning is a form of progressive elaboration where work to be accomplished in the near term is planned in detail and future work is planned at a higher level of the WBS. Therefore, work can exist at various levels of detail, depending on where it is in the project life cycle. As more information is known about upcoming events, the near-term higher-level work packages can be decomposed further [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.185]

column2: You are estimating the duration of your project activities using a triangular distribution formula. For a particular project activity, your Optimistic estimate is 14 days, Pessimistic estimate is 49 days, and Most Likely estimate is 27 days. What is the expected duration of this activity?
column7: Triangular distribution allows the estimator to include three estimates: optimistic, pessimistic, and most likely. The expected duration is calculated using the equation: Expected Duration = [P + ML + O/3], where P is the pessimistic estimate, ML is the most likely estimate, and ) is the optimistic estimate. Using this method, the correct answer 14+49+27/3=30 days. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.201]

column2: During a unique product development project, you notice that the requirements are conceptual and that it is difficult to obtain a shared understanding by all stakeholders. What can you do to obtain a shared understanding of the project's requirements?
column5: Hold brainstorming sessions with the stakeholders.
column7: Prototyping is a method of obtaining early feedback on requirements by providing a model of the expected product before actually building it. Examples of prototypes are small-scale products, computer generated 2D and 3D models, mock-ups, or simulations. Prototypes allow stakeholders to experiment with a model of the final product rather than being limited to discussing abstract representations of their requirements. SO the project manager could obtain a shared understanding of the project's requirements by Build a prototype. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 147]

What type of communication methods should the project manager have used to avoid this?

column3: Inform stakeholders with the new status of the project
column7: The first step after the approved Change request is Update the change log . all change requests are recorded in the change log as a project document update. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 120]

column2: The Project team members and the subject matter expert (SME) are working on a design development project. You discover an enhancement that will improve the design. What should you as the project manager do?
column3: Ask the subject matter expert (SME) to implement the enhancement.
column4: Document this discovery, and present it to all stakeholders.
column5: Ignore the enhancement, as no changes are allowed.
column6: Ask the change control board (CCB) to review the enhancement.
column7: Since the enhancement may impact the project baseline, so the next step, ask the change control board (CCB) to review the enhancement and make a decision. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.113]

column2: Using quantitative risk analysis and modeling technique that helps to determine which risks have the most impact on a project. Your goal is to find whether the occurrence of a particular threat would be merely an inconvenience or would ruin the project. Which of the following tools will be most appropriate for your analysis?
column7: A tornado diagram is a diagramming method to display sensitivity analysis data by examining all the uncertain elements at their baseline values. It gives a quick overview of how much the project will be impacted by various elements. The element with the greatest impact on the project appears at the top. This diagram can be used to determine sensitivity in cost, time, and objectives and is helpful in determining detailed response plans for elements with greater impacts. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.434]

column2: The change control board (CCB) recently approved two change requests. 1st was a delay in activity on the critical path due to insufficient resources. 2nd was due to sending late communications to stakeholders. What should you do FIRST as a project manager?
column4: Hire additional resources to do both at the same time
column7: The project manager should ask the CCB for further clarifications/explanations to Ensure that changes are made in a timely manner and Ensure changes are implemented in sequence. The CCB may also review configuration management activities. The roles and responsibilities of these boards are clearly defined and agreed upon by the appropriate stakeholders and are documented in the change management plan. CCB decisions are documented and communicated to the stakeholders for information and follow-up actions. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 121]

column2: The GM keeps asking for changes to the project scope that are not consistent with the original project requirements. One of the changes was requested one month before the project launch date. This change is projected to cause significant project delays. What should the project manager do?
column3: Continue with the launch date as per the approved project management plan.
column5: Inform the project steering committee about the project delay risk.
column6: Submit a change request to the change control board (CCB).
column7: Because changes to the project scope - cause significant project delays .. The project manager should Submit a change request to the change control board (CCB) for reviewing and approval. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.113]

column2: You have a project that is three months behind but is surprisingly markedly under budget. You have decided to try to make up time, but needs to minimize the project risk. What is the best thing to do?
column7: Crashing (adding resources) may be done as the project is within budget and crashing usually incurs an extra cost. Fast-tracking will increase the risk therefore not an option. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.215]

column2: You are working on a critical deliverable encounter a major change that affects the schedule baseline and the next milestone deliverable. You have assessed the impact of the change on the project constraints with your team, and the change control board just approved a change request. In which process will this change be implemented?
column7: Direct and Manage Project Work is the process of leading and performing the work defined in the project management plan and implementing approved changes to achieve the project's objectives. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 90]

column2: The project manager is in the initiation phase of his project. What area should he consider when developing the business case?
column4: Expected resource performance to the strategic portfolio objectives.
column5: Expected resource performance and cost-benefit analysis
column6: Business benefits and the organizational strategy.
column7: When developing the business case, the project manager should consider the business benefits and organizational strategy. Conduct benefit analysis with relevant stakeholders to validate project alignment with organizational strategy and expected business value. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.29]

column2: Ben is the new project manager who has never managed a project before. He has been asked to plan a new project. Which of the following will help him to improve his chance of choices?
column7: Because Ben has no experience, he will have to look at the experience of others. This information is captured in the historical records from previous projects. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.79]

column2: You are the project manager of the Telecom Project and are working with the project stakeholders to determine the project requirements. You and the stakeholders are brainstorming privately to come up with as many solutions to the project as possible. After the brainstorming session, a recorder documents all the solutions on a white board so everyone can see the ideas and how they may be related. After the solutions have been documented, you lead the group through a voting process to discuss and rank each idea and requirement that has been proposed. What is this technique called?
column7:
The nominal group technique enhances brainstorming with a voting process used
to rank the most useful ideas for further brainstorming or for prioritization. The nominal group technique is a
structured form of brainstorming. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.144]

column2: Suzi is the project manager on a civil project. When she hears that her project has run into a snag due to weeks of bad weather on the job site, she says "No problem, we have insurance that covers cost overruns due to weather." What risk response strategy did she use?
column7: ( Transference), because of insurance. The transfer involves shifting ownership of a threat to a third party to manage the risk and to bear the impact if the threat occurs. A transfer can be achieved by a range of actions, which include but are not limited to the use of insurance, performance bonds, warranties, guarantees. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 443]

column2:
During sequencing activities, your team defines that:
? Activity A has a duration of three weeks. 
? Activity C with a duration of four weeks, will start first. 
? Activity B with a duration of two weeks, will start after completion of activity A 
? Activity D, with a duration of four weeks, will start with a lead time of one week upon completion of activity B 
? Activity E with a duration of five weeks, will start after the completion of activity C 
? Activity F, with a duration of three weeks, will have a start to start dependency with activity E, with a lag time of three weeks 
What is the project's critical path?
column7: To calculate the project's Critical Path "shortest possible duration" , you should start drawing the network and sum the duration of the longest path to calculate the shortest possible duration First Path ( A-B-D = 8 Weeks ) Second Path ( C-E-F = 10 Weeks ) [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.210]

Therefore, they tell him to check the product acceptance criteria again before calling the client. What document will the PM look at to get this information.?

column2: You are the project manager of a project near completion. After sending a follow-up report to the stakeholders, some stakeholders comment that some unresolved issues have been excluded from the report. What should you have done to prevent this?
column3: Conducted the monitor Stakeholder Engagement process.
column7: The monitor communication process requires reviewing data from the issue log, the issue log provides the project's history, a record of stakeholder engagement issues, and how they were resolved. The issue log may be updated with new information on issues raised, their progress, and resolution. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 389, 390, 393]
