column2: A project manager has just learned that his project's sole equipment supplier has gone out of business. It is an unanticipated risk and will cause a delay in the project until a new vendor can be selected and contracts put in place. What do the PM do?
column3: Continue working on non-critical path tasks.
column4: Put out into RFP for new vendors.
column7: It?s an unanticipated risk, and will cause a delay, so the best thing to do as a project manager is Notify the project stakeholders (its workaround action to deal with unanticipated risk) [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.443]

column2: A key stakeholder has removed a key team resource from a project. The activities on the critical path will be negatively affected by this action. What should the project manager do?
column3: Analyze the impact to the project management plan and submit a change request.
column4: Engage the sponsor to discuss the importance of the resource with the functional leader.
column5: Negotiate with and influence the functional leader to reverse their decision.
column6: Acquire a replacement resource by following the resource management plan.
column7: There is no benefit from the Negotiation with the functional leader to reverse their decision. Not good practice to Engage the sponsor as a first step. The project manager should Acquire a replacement resource by following the resource management plan because the critical path will be negatively affected by this action. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.330]

column2: A project manager has signed a multi-year contract with a customer to complete a project for a fixed price. Since the duration of the contract is long, the PM has added a provision to adjust the price of the contract according to the market inflation. What kind of contract is this?
column6:
Fixed price with 
economic price adjustment
column7: The fixed price with economic price adjustment: This type is used whenever the seller's performance period spans a considerable period of years, or if the payments are made in a different currency. It is a fixed-price contract, but with a special provision allowing for predefined final adjustments to the contract price due to changed conditions, such as inflation changes or cost increases (or decreases) for specific commodities. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 471]

column2: You receives an email from a vendor that a key deliverables will be delayed by a month. What should you as the project manager do first?
column3: Call the vendor to obtain a justification for the delay.
column4: Update the management and obtain their advice.
column5: Meet with the team identify ways to absorb this delay.
column6: Assess the impact of the delay on the project plan.
column7: The project manager should FIRST Assess the impact of the delay on the project plan then take the corrective action such as Meet with the team identify ways to absorb this delay to find solutions. Option ( Update the management and obtain their advice. ) not good practice as the project manager should be proactive and find ways to solve the problems with the team members. Option Call the vendor to obtain a justification for the delay. ) not good also because he already received an email from a vendor that a key deliverables will be delayed by a month and the calling not will be useful. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.419]

column2: You want to confirm that the project team implemented best practices for the requirements-gathering process. What should you as the project manager do?
column7: Quality audit objectives include: Identifying all good and best practices being implemented, sharing good practices introduced or implemented in similar projects in the organization and/or industry; and proactively offering assistance in a positive manner to improve the implementation of processes to help raise team productivity. So the project manager should perform a quality audit to confirm that the project team implemented best practices for the requirements-gathering process. [PMBOK 6th edition page, 294]

column2: The customer always asks for a lot of changes in scope and product features during the project execution. You accept all changes to meet customer satisfaction. After a period of implementation, you noticed inflation in the budget. What should you have done to prevent this situation?
column7: Change management plan, which provides the direction for managing the change control process and documents the formal change control board (CCB). if the PM implemented the change requests without analyzing the impact of the changes on time and cost and quality will increase the risks in the project and lead to increased costs (cost overruns). [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.88]

column2: A project manager decides to procure the full amount of a required project material to exploit a price-volume discount. column2: Risk event should be removed from your project. The removal of the requirements does affect your project scope, but it can release the project from high-risk exposure. What risk response has been enacted in this project?
column7: Risk avoidance is when the project team acts to eliminate the threat or protect the project from its impact. Avoidance may involve changing some aspect of the project management plan or changing the objective that is in jeopardy in order to eliminate the threat entirely, reducing its probability of occurrence to zero. Examples of avoidance actions may include removing the cause of a threat, extending the schedule, changing the project strategy, or reducing scope. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 443 ]

column2: You are informed that one of the suppliers who is working on your project has taken another project during the implementation phase. As a project manager, what should you do next?
column5: Remove the supplier from your project.
column7: Performance reviews for contracts measure, compare and analyze quality, resource, schedule, and cost performance against the agreement. column2: On a virtual project status meeting, there is a team member who consistently has issues with the technology being used to join the meeting. These issues are preventing this team member from being actively engaged in the meetings. What should the project manager do?
column3: Ask another team member to follow up and provide updates to the team member.
column4: Call this team member separately to communicate the project status.
column5: Replace the team member with someone who has more technology experience.
column6: Have a separate meeting with the team member to find a solution together.
column7: The project manager should have a separate meeting with the team member to find a solution together because these issues are preventing this team member from being actively engaged in the meetings. This is an example of solve problem technique. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.356]

column2: William is the project manager of the civil Project. He and the project team have identified a risk event in the project with a high probability of occurrence and the risk event has a high-cost impact on the project. William discusses the risk event with Virginia, the primary project customer, and she decides that the requirements surrounding the risk event should be removed from the project. The removal of the requirements does affect the project scope, but it can release the project from high-risk exposure. What risk response has been enacted in this project?
column7:
Avoid. Where the level of overall project risk is significantly negative and outside the agreed-upon risk
thresholds for the project, an avoid strategy may be adopted. This involves taking focused action to reduce
the negative effect of uncertainty on the project as a whole and bring the project back within the thresholds. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page.445]

column2: During the execution phase. A risk management plan has been implemented and risk analysis is ongoing. How should the impacts of identified risks be communicated to the stakeholder?
column3: Show the reasons for upcoming risks using either an affinity diagram or a matrix diagram.
column4: Engage in opportunity management on the identified risks for added value.
column5: Calculate the necessary contingency funding and time buffers needed for the risk response.
column6: Draw a probability and impact matrix to prioritize risks.
column7: Draw a probability and impact matrix or a hierarchical chart to prioritize risks to communicate the impacts of identified risks to the stakeholder. A probability and impact matrix is a grid for mapping the probability of each risk occurrence and its impact on project objectives if that risk occurs. Hierarchical charts. Where risks have been categorized using more than two parameters, the probability and impact matrix cannot be used and other graphical representations are required [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 425]

column2: On your project, two team members often disagree. You need a long-term conflict resolution method. You decide to use which one of the following approaches?
column7: ( Problem-solving ) which provides a long-term resolution. Collaborate/problem solve. This approach can result in a win-win situation. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 349]

column2: You want to recruit another team member to replace an architect who resigned from your project. What document should capture this change?
column7: RAMs are used within the group to designate roles, responsibilities, and levels of authority for specific activities. The matrix format shows all activities associated with one person and all people associated with one activity. This also ensures that there is only one person accountable for any one task to avoid confusion about who is ultimately in charge or has authority for the work. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 317]

column2: You are managing a project in which your team members all work in the same  location and have worked together on many projects. You have seniors and junior team members. Senior team members feel that they are always overloaded and junior team members are not learning that fast. As a Project manager, what should you do?
column3: Focus on decreasing sources of conflicts Team
column6: Recognition and Rewards throughout the project
column7: People are motivated when they feel they are valued in the organization and the rewards are given to they demonstrate this value. Most project team members are motivated by an opportunity to grow, accomplish, and apply their professional skills to meet new challenges. A good strategy for project managers is to give team recognition throughout the life cycle of the project rather than waiting until the project is completed. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 342]

column2: The customer has requested a change in the scope which you have processed through a change request and it is approved from CCB. Now, you are in the process of implementing this change into the project. In which of the following processes do you implement the approved change?

column2: As a project manager, you discover that the concrete's composition is incorrect. What document should the project manager reviews to verify the concrete's performance and quality requirements?
column7: The Procurement statement of work (SOW) Include, specifications, quantity desired, quality levels, performance data, period of performance, work location, and other requirements. The SOW describes the procurement item in sufficient detail to allow prospective sellers to determine if they are capable of providing the products, services, or results. Sufficient detail can vary based on the nature of the item, the needs of the buyer, or the expected contract form. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 477]

column2: The relevant stakeholders inspected the deliverables and found that  that there has been a change in the company strategy. Therefore, important changes must be made to the requirements. The project manager believes that these changes make the deliverables unstable. What should the project manager do?
column3: Request the details about the new requirements, evaluate them with the project team, and recommend whether to continue or close the project.
column4: Evaluate the impact on the project, coordinate with the sponsor and close the project.
column5: Evaluate and incorporate the changes to the project management plan to start executing them.
column6: Request that the stakeholders specify the new requirements and present them to the change control board (CCB).
column7: Keyword ( important changes MUST be made to the requirements ) Any changes in project requirement can impact the baseline will require formal change request to take the approval from CCB. SO the project manager should Request that the stakeholders specify the new requirements and present them to the change control board (CCB). other options not correct because the change request can not be implemented without the approval by CCB. the other option ( close the project after evaluate the impact on project not correct ),  [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 117, 120]

column2: After the project charter is approved, what should you do NEXT?
column7: After the project charter is approved the next step should identify stakeholder but this option not included in the Choices so the correct answer is Scope management plan because it includes: Process for preparing a project scope statement and Process that establishes how the scope baseline will be approved and maintained. option (business case) prepared before the project. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 134]

column7: After the project charter is approved the next step should identify stakeholder but this option not included in the Choices so the correct answer is Scope management plan because it includes: Process for preparing a project scope statement and Process that establishes how the scope baseline will be approved and maintained. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 134]

column2: You have recently been assigned as a project manager to manage a project that was terminated five months ago because of funding related issues, but which has since been re-initiated. You want to find out the exact reasons for the termination of the project. You also want to know which deliverables were produced from the terminated project. Which of the following documentation should you review to obtain this information?
column7: Project or phase closure documents, consisting of formal documentation that indicates completion of the project or phase and the transfer of the completed project or phase deliverables to others, such as an operations group or to the next phase. During project closure, the project manager reviews prior phase documentation, customer acceptance documentation from the Validate Scope. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 128].

column2: Four team members have just joined the project you are leading. The project is medium and involves many stakeholders. You want to get the new team members up to speed with the overall dynamics of the project and engage effectively with the project stakeholders. What should you do?
column3: Schedule a meeting with the new team members and all project stakeholders
column4: Submit a change request to update the stakeholder engagement plan
column5: Ask the team members to record any issues they encounter into the issue log
column6: Review the stakeholder register with the new team members
column7: The stakeholder register is a project document that contains all current information about the stakeholders. The stakeholder register includes stakeholder identification information, assessment information, and stakeholder classification. It is used by the project team to maintain information about the stakeholder's expectations and interests with the project. By reviewing the stakeholder register with the new team members, the project manager can provide them with the information about each project stakeholder, politics surrounding the project, and other relevant details about the project and the stakeholders that may help the new team member. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 514]

[PMBOK ια γ΅ ι«§«΅ ? ι­ε¥΅ 514]

column2: You are a Project Manager in a Engineering company.  the sponsor of project has just developed the project charter, and has also provided you with a list of the project's key stakeholders that he has identified. He then asks you to immediately gather the requirements. What should be your next step as the project manager?
column4: Prepare a power/interest matrix for key stakeholders
column6: Conduct the stakeholder identification process to identify all stakeholder's
column7: Stakeholder identification is an important process in the initiating phase of a project and should be performed immediately after the project charter has been developed. Although the project sponsor has provided you with a list of what he considers "key" stakeholders, you must perform the Identify Stakeholders process until "all" stakeholders have been identified. Only then can you move on to the Planning processes of Plan Stakeholder Management and Collect Requirements. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 514]

column2: During the team review, the project manager learns that the schedule performance index (SPI) is 0.6 and the cost performance index (CPI) is 0.8. The project manager asks team members to work overtime. How will this effect the ( CPI ) ?
column7: (SPI) is 0.6 and ( CPI ) is 0.8 it's mean that the project is behind schedule and over budget. So the added overtime will increase the actual cost (AC) so the CPI will decreases.  [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 267]

column2: A project team is staffed with experienced subject matter experts. The project is going well and there are no known quality issues. Team members believe that the quality control process is unnecessary for this project. What should the project manager do?
column3: Review the risk management plan to update risks.
column4: Create a cause and effect diagram to quantify impact.
column5: Remove the process from the quality management plan.
column6: Create a team culture that is committed to quality
column7: Although the project is going well and there are no known quality issues, but the quality management processes are necessary , It applies to all projects to meet customer requirements and decrease the employee attrition, errors, or rework. So the project manager should create a team culture that is committed to quality. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 338].

column2: What is the key purpose of the Monitoring and Controlling process group?
column3: Perform preventive actions so that no variances ever occur in the project lifecycle
column6: Measure project performance in order to identify and quantify any variances and perform approved corrective actions
column7: Measure project performance in order to identify and quantify any variances and perform approved corrective actions. Preventive actions should be identified and implemented during this process group but they will not ensure that variances won't take place throughout the project lifecycle. Only conducting daily status meetings will not assist in monitoring and controlling the project. Refer to PMP Exam Outline in the Monitoring and Controlling Process Group ( Task no 1 ) [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 613].

column2: You are working on a project to construct four buildings complex. The project management plan calls for completion of one building per year at a cost of US$ 100 Million each. At the end of year three, 1st Building was completed at a cost of US$100 million & 2nd Building completed at a cost of US$120 million & 3rd Building only 50% completed at a cost of US$ 60 million. To meet the original project management plan, what monthly performance is needed until the end of year four?
column7:
Here he ask to calculate the To Complete Performance Index TCPI , to meet the original project management plan you should use the equation 
TCPI= (BAC-EV) / (BAC-AC) 
BAC= 4*100 M = 400 M 
AC= 100 M+ 120M + 60M = 280 M 
EV= 2.5/4 X 400 M =250 M 
So, the TCPI= (BAC-EV) / (BAC-AC) 
( 400 M -250 M ) / ( 400 M - 280 M ) = 1.25 = 125 %. 
[PMBOK 6th edition, Page 267]

Άκ ιλΆμ κλ ικ λξ ινι  Άθιε΅ 100 κιονλ §νι© κ©οθο νΆκ ιλΆμ κλ ικ λξ ι£λο  Άθιε΅ 120 κιονλ §νι© κ©οθο νικ λξ ι£ι£ θΆκι  λ« ΅ 50? εηα ν Άθιε΅ 60 κιονλ §νι© κ©οθο. ιΆι ο΅ ¦α΅ §©΅ ικ¬©νγ ι­ιο΅ ? κ μν ι§ ι¬μ©ο ικαιν  ¥Άξ λμο΅ ι«λ΅ ι© γ΅?

TCPI = (BAC-EV) / (BAC-AC) 
BAC = 4*100 M = 400 M 
AC = 100 M + 120M + 60M = 280 M 
EV = 2.5 / 4 X 400 M = 250 M
 ι¨ ελ  TCPI = (BAC-EV) / (BAC-AC) 
(400 M -250 M) / (400 M - 280 M) = 1.25 = 125?. 
[PMBOK ια γ΅ ι«§«΅ ? ι­ε¥΅ 267]

column2: You are a project manager in a infrastructure project. During a review, the project team member identifies a quality issue that may cause the product to be rejected by the customer. However, the project sponsor wants to deliver the product. As a project manager, what should you do?
column3: Ensure that the product meets customer requirements.
column7: The Quality issue may or may not cause the product to be rejected by the customer. SO, the project manager should first Review the quality checklist. Quality checklist used to verify that a set of required steps has been performed or to check if a list of requirements has been satisfied. Quality checklists should incorporate the acceptance criteria included in the scope baseline. After reviewing the Quality checklist by the project manager and verifying the existence of an issue, the issue must then be presented to the customer and if he not accept the product then it must be recorded in the issue log to start track and find the solution. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 292, 302]

column2: You are a project manager of a company and you are in the implementation phase. The commercial authorities sent a notice to the project manager to stop work. What should the project manager have done to avoid this?
column4: Defined a detailed scope of work.
column5: Developed a detailed project management plan.
column7: To prevent this situation, the project manager should identify all the stakeholders that can impact the project. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 524]
column8: λΆ κ§ο© κ¬©νγ εο ¬©θ΅ νλΆ εο κ©¥ι΅ ιΆλεο¨. ν©«ιΆ ι«ιαΆ ιΆ¤©ο΅ ¦α©ρ ιξ κ§ο© ικ¬©νγ  νηε ιγκι. κ ι¨ο θλ ο¤  γιξ κ§ο© ικ¬©νγ εγιμ ιΆ¤λ  ¨ιθ?

column2: A project manager is in the process of identifying the likely stakeholders on a project and their interests in the project. The project manager has just compiled a list of potential stakeholders' names. What should the project manager do next?
column3: Conduct kick-off meeting to inform and engage stakeholders and gain commitment
column7: The question suggests that the project is still in the initiation stage, with the initial iteration of the Identify Stakeholders process, and has yet to progress to project planning. At this point, the project manager has only compiled a list of potential stakeholders' names. With only a list of individual and group names, the next logical step is to perform stakeholder analysis. Stakeholder analysis, an example of the data analysis technique which can be used during the Identify Stakeholder process, results in a list of stakeholders and relevant information such as their positions in the organization, roles on the project, expectations, attitudes, and their interest about the project. Therefore, of the available choices, conducting stakeholder analysis is what the project manager should do next.  [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 512]

column2: Your project has been progressing well so far. Due to an unexpected increase in the cost of raw materials which was not factored as project risk, you are in need of some management reserve. The management reserve is available but the sponsor asks you to do something to obtain it. What is the sponsor asking you to do?
column3: There is no need for a management reserve as the risk was not factored, and therefore it may be funded from the contingency reserve
column4: To put in a request to the sponsor for the management reserve
column5: To first move the required funds from the contingency reserve to the management reserve
column6: To follow the change approval process to move the required management reserve funds to the cost baseline
column7: A standard procedure in such a situation is to obtain change approval to move the required funds from the management reserve to the cost baseline and then use that amount from the cost baseline. All other options are incorrect. Putting in a request to the sponsor has already been done. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 269]

column2: You are managing a project with a budget of $ 9,000, and $ 1,500 has been spent. However, you only completed $1000 worth of work. Your schedule says that you should have completed 50% of the work. What is the estimate at completion (EAC)?
column3: US$ 9000 ( Based on original project Budget )
column5: US$13500 ( Based on original project Budget )
column7: The most common formula for EAC is BAC/CPI. CPI=EV/AC =1000/1500= 0.66 So, EAC=9000/0.66 =13500. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 267]

column13:
ικγ§ι΅ ιθ£© ¬ονγρ ι• EAC μο BAC / CPI
CPI = EV / AC = 1000/1500 = 0.66 
ι¨ ? EAC = 9000 / 0.66 = 13500. 
[PMBOK ια γ΅ ι«§«΅ ? ι­ε¥΅ 267]

column2: During the execution of the project, you had to manage a change request. You evaluated the impact of the change on the other constraints of the project, then you got the change request approved by Change Control Board CCB. The next step you should do is:
column4: Inform stakeholders with new status of the project.
column7: The next step after approved the change request by CCB is to update change log and Update the Plans and affected baselines before implementing the approved change request [PMBOK 6th edition, Page115]

column2: During the initiation phase, the project manager classifying a list of project stakeholders and discovers an interested stakeholder with little authority. How should project manager manage this stakeholder?
column7: The stakeholder is interested in the project with little authority so you will keep him informed. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 514]

column2: You are a project manager to construct a new industries in a typhoon prone area and may impact the schedule and quality. As a project manager, what should you do?
column4: Perform Quantitative Risk Analysis, and plan risk response
column5: Develop the risk management plan and establish a management reserve
column6: Outsource the project and transfer the risk
column7: The best risk response strategy appropriate for this project, Outsource the project and transfer the risk to complete this work and shifting ownership of a threat to a third party to manage the risk and to bear the impact if the threat occurs. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 443].

column2: A project manager leading constructing dams and must provide cost estimates to stakeholders. What should the project manager present to avoid unreasonable cuts in the budget that will undermine the project?
column4: Cost estimates as per historical data and other variables.
column6: Bottom-up cost as the basis for the estimate.
column7: Bottom-up estimating is a method of estimating a component of work. The cost of individual work packages or activities is estimated to the greatest level of specified detail.[PMBOK 6th edition, Page 244]

column2: Project stakeholders are concerned that the project changes may have an unplanned impact on the business documents. They want to understand these changes before they occur. What should the project manager do?
column3: Update the change management plan to track and communicate change.
column4: Escalate all changes to key stakeholders to obtain agreement before implementation.
column5: Ensure that all potential changes are part of the risk mitigation plan.
column6: Review the project plan to handle upcoming change requests.
column7: The project stakeholders want to understand changes before they occur because of the change management plan is a part of the project management plan, so the project manager should review the project plan to handle upcoming change requests. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page115]

column2: You are managing a houses project, your cost performance is not as planned and your Project is over budget. Therefore, you again estimate the cost of the project and find that you will require more funding to complete the project. This will require an update of the cost baseline. What will you do?
column7: If there is a change which requires an update to the cost baseline, you will raise It, get it approved, and then update the cost baseline. [The PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page: 113, 115].

column2: The project manager reviews the issue log at the end of each day. One issue she recorded in the issue log stems from delays in the delivery of resources from a contracted supplier. What tool should the project manager use to determine if corrective action is necessary?
column7: The scenario suggests the Control Procurements process is underway. Audits are among the tools and techniques of this process and are typically used to evaluate a documented procedure to ensure the procedure is being carried out according to plan and analyzed for improvements. In this situation, an audit can be used to review the schedule for the delivery of material per the contract. The audit results inform the project manager whether changes need to be made to the schedule. If the seller is delinquent I in delivering the material, the audit results will also allow the project manager to determine what, if any, corrective action should be conducted. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 498].

column2: You are a project manager of a company and your project is currently in the execution phase. In your project there is an issue requires the execution of the contingency plan, which impacts the schedule baseline. As a project manager, what should you do?
column5: Do nothing as this would cause changes to the baselines.
column7: The execution of the contingency plan will impact the project schedule, so the next step is to Issue a change request. Change requests are processed for review and disposition through the Perform Integrated Change Control process. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 115]

column7: The Project team avoid new technology because of the high risk associated. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 443].

column2: The project manager hired a team to check the quality, but the project manager cannot obtain stakeholder consensus on the team's composition. What selection criteria can the project manager present to influence consensus?
column3: Knowledge of stakeholder expectations, market landscape, and project scope statement.
column4: Knowledge of the product benchmark, business case and quality assurance.
column5: Knowledge of the stakeholder engagement plan, approval criteria and document specifications.
column6: Knowledge of customer requirements, organizational policies and industry standards and project metrics.
column7: Knowledge of customer requirements, organizational policies and industry standards and project metrics. [PMBOK 6th Page, 332]

column2: The project manager had been appointed recently in marketing Project. A team member informs you with a serious concern that impacts the project. You start to record the details, identifies an owner, and sets a realistic date for resolution. What document did the project manager update?
column7: The issue log will help the project manager effectively track and manage issues, ensuring that they are investigated and resolved [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 96]

column2: You are is a project manager leading huge project with 100 million dollars. Various teams from different countries are involved in this project and the teams need to work cohesively and seamlessly for the success of the project. The task of one team member is highly dependent on that of other team members. Which of the following is important for the overall success of project integration?
column4: Adherence to professional code of conduct
column5: Detailed definition of the work packages
column7: The communication management plan is vital for the success of project integration. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 377].

column2: A stakeholder with a high degree of impact now requires more detailed project reports. What should the project manager do?
column3: Meet with the project sponsor to discuss the issue.
column4: Escalate the issue to the project management office.
column5: Work with the project team to prepare a new project charter.
column6: Work with the project team to update the communication management plan.
column7: Since the stakeholder with a high degree of impact requires more detailed project reports, the project manager should work with the project team to update the communication management plan because it includes the stakeholder communication requirement , Information to be communicated, including language, format, content, and level of detail. PMBOK 6th edition page, 377

column2: Your project team works in two different cities across the country. The team has been struggling to perform effectively, morale is low and has a difficult time resolving problems. What would be the BEST team development technique to resolve this issue?
column7: Colocation involves placing many or all of the most active project team members in the same physical location to enhance their ability to perform as a team. Colocation strategies can include a team meeting room, common places to post schedules, and other conveniences that enhance communication and a sense of community. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page340 ]

column2: As a project manager, in which document will you find information about the acceptable level of project and product quality and how to ensure this level of quality in its deliverables and processes?
column7: The acceptable level of project and product quality and how to ensure this level of quality in its deliverables and processes are part of the information in the project management plan as it includes the quality management plan as one of its components, so, option (The project management plan) is the right answer. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 286]

column2: After contract sign-off , a project manager has been informed him that that the vendor has a bad reputation for delaying the materials delivery and not meet the time agreed in  the contract. To ensure the vendor's compliance, what should the project manager do?
column3: Cancel the current contract and select another vendor
column4: Conduct a make-or-buy analysis to verify vendor reliability
column5: Insist on a firm fixed price contract (FFP) with the vendor
column6: Perform periodic inspection of the vendor's work and progress.
column7: To ensure the vendor's compliance, the project manager should perform periodic inspection of the vendor's work and progress to take the corrective action as per the contract at the right time. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 498].

column2: You are managing a project to construct commercial buildings. During the project kick-off meeting, two project team members had a disagreement around whether to include a specific test within testing scenarios for the new product or not. As the project manager, what should you do?
column5: Ask each one of them to explain the logic behind his opinion
column6: Postpone the discussion for a later time
column7: If you were to "Add the suggested scenario", or "Reject adding the new test", it will be a premature decision as you didn't discuss the reasoning behind both opinions, and since this is the project kick-off meeting and there's no time pressure for resolving the conflict "Postpone the discussion for later time" seems an appealing approach, if you were to "Ask each one of them to explain the logic behind his opinion, it won't be the right time for such discussion. The best course of action is to "Postpone the discussion for a later time". [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 349].

[PMBOK ια γ΅ ι«§«΅? ι­ε¥΅ 349].

column2: You are managing a large engineering project. Your project team works in two different industries across the city. You want to communicate the vision and inspire the project team to achieve high performance. Which of the following skills help the project manager?
column7: Successful projects require leaders with strong leadership skills. Leadership is the ability to lead a team and inspire them to do their jobs well. It encompasses a wide range of skills, abilities, and actions. Leadership is important through all phases of the project life cycle. There are multiple leadership theories defining leadership styles that should be used as needed for each situation or team. It is especially important to communicate the vision and inspire the project team to achieve high performance. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 350]

column2: You are a project manager in an Manufacturing project. You and key stakeholders start conducting a project benefit analysis. Because of the solutions that have not been identified, an engineer from another department has informed you that there are affected systems. As a project manager, what should you do?
column4: Review the project benefit analysis to consider the additional impact
column6: Document the issue in the issue log
column7: The issue log is a project document used to identify and monitor issues that occur in the project. The issue log can be updated with any new issues found during the project and described in the scenario because of the solutions that have not been identified causing the system are affected. Making this choice the best answer to the question asked. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 298]

column2: You are a project manager managing a decoration project. Your project team sent confidential information to the subcontractor by mistake. What could have prevented this situation?
column7: The communications management plan is a component of the project management plan that describes how project communications will be planned, structured, implemented, and monitored for effectiveness. The plan contains the following information: Person responsible for authorizing the release of confidential information; Stakeholder communication requirements; Escalation processes; Timeframe and frequency for the distribution of required information and Person responsible for communicating the information. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 377]

column2: You are responsible for leading the HR Project. The customer has requested a change in the scope which you have processed through a change request and it is approved from CCB, and the team members Updated the Scope and Schedule baselines to reflect the approved changes. What should you do next?
column3: Inform the sponsor about the approved change request
column6: Inform the impacted stakeholders about the approved change request
column7: After updating the impacted baselines, you should inform the stakeholders about the approved change request. Option ( Inform the sponsor about the approved change request ) is incorrect because the project sponsor is a part of The CCB and has information about the approved change. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 115]

column2: A project manager is asked to contribute to a document to describe what is intended to be achieved with a project once it is successfully finished, and how this will be measured. What could be the name of that document?
column7: The project benefits management plan is the document that describes how and when the benefits of the project will be delivered, and describes the mechanisms that should be in place to measure those benefits. A project benefit is defined as an outcome of actions, behaviors, products, services, or results that provide value to the sponsoring organization as well as to the project's intended beneficiaries. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 33]

column2: Your company has created an electronic network to share information between stakeholders and access to information at any time. Which communication method is used?
column7: An electronic network is a form of Pull communication. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 374]

column2: As the project manager of a constructing hospitals project, you are determining the accuracy of the deliverables before closing a project. What process should be used to determine this and is an input to formalizing acceptance?
column7: Validate Scope is the process of formalizing acceptance of the completed project deliverables. The verified deliverables obtained from the Control Quality process are reviewed with the customer or sponsor to ensure they are completed satisfactorily and have received formal acceptance of the deliverables by the customer or sponsor. Verified deliverables is the key inputs of validate scope process and outputs of Control quality process.[PMBOK 6th edition, Page 164]

ΆΆκ κ©¤γ΅ ιΆ«ιοκΆ ιΆο Άκ ιΆ¥ηη κλμ νιΆο Άκ ι¥­νι γιομ κλ γκιο΅ ιΆ¥θκ  ι¤ν§΅ κγ ιγκοι ν ι©γο ιιΆθ§ κλ θΆκιμ  ¬θι κ©ΰ νΆιηομ η νιρ ©«κορ ιιλνΆ¤ κλ η ι ιγκοι ν ι©γο. ιΆ«ιοκΆ ιΆο Άκ ιΆ¥ηη κλμ μο ικ§¦ιΆ ι©ο«ο΅ ιγκιο΅ ιΆ¥ηη κλ ιλαη νκ¦©¤Ά κλ γκιο΅ ιΆ¥θκ  ι¤ν§΅. column2: Situational Awareness is a key interpersonal skill for all effective project managers and means knowing what is going on around you and being able to quickly switch your focus. What another skill is often used in conjunction with Situational Awareness where you the project manager, have to be persuasive in expressing your point and position in order for your project team and stakeholders to react quickly to changing project priorities?
column7: Influencing is an interpersonal skill that involves awareness of, and consideration for, the various perspectives in any situation. It helps you gather relevant and critical information in order to address changing project priorities and resolve unexpected project challenges. It is often used in conjunction with the Situational Awareness interpersonal tool.. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 350]

column2: Risks of quality defect on project deliverables may occurre. In Which category these risks should be included?
column7:
Risk categories provide a means for grouping individual project risks. A common way to structure risk categories
is with a risk breakdown structure (RBS). [PMBOK 6th edition. Page 406]

column2: During the development phase of an IT implementation project, the client refuses to grant the project team access to their database. Since this is essential for configuration of the application, the project deliverables could be impacted. What should the project manager do next?
column3: Discuss it with the project team and update the project schedule.
column4: Review the project statement of work (SOW).
column5: Log it in the risk register.
column6: Update the issue log and meet with the client to review.
column7: Since the client refuses to grant the project team access to their database this is an issue and the project manager should first update the issue log and meet with the client to review and solve it. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 523]

column2: You want to know which deliverables were produced from the terminated project. Which of the following documentation should you review to obtain this information?
column7: Project or phase closure documents, consisting of formal documentation that indicates completion of the project or phase and the transfer of the completed project or phase deliverables to others, such as an operations group or to the next phase. During project closure, the project manager reviews prior phase documentation, customer acceptance documentation from the Validate Scope process, and the agreement (if applicable) to ensure that all project requirements are completed prior to finalizing the closure of the project. If the project was terminated prior to completion, the formal documentation indicates why the project was terminated and formalizes the procedures for the transfer of the finished and unfinished deliverables of the cancelled project to others.. [PMBOK 6t1 edition, Page 128)

column2:
You are the project manager of  important project. Your project must be completed by September 10 and cannot exceed $12,000. 
$12,000 is an example of which one of the following?
column7: Constraints are limitations placed upon the project that the project manager and team must work within. there are scope, schedule and cost constraints. (how much funding has been allocated). and the three constraints are commonly called the triple constraints. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 253]

column2: A vendor has a contract to deliver products for a project on the first week of each month. An inspection reveals that some product components are not meeting design requirements. What should the project manager do next?
column3: Conduct an audit of all deliverables and hire another vendor.
column4: Demand the necessary corrections from the vendor and update the progress report.
column5: Request an audit of all deliverables and apply penalties to the vendors.
column6: Insist that the vendor make all necessary corrections and update the risk register.
column7: Because of some product components are not meeting design requirements, the vendor should make all necessary corrections and update the risk register then analyze the impact on project objectives. Options ( Conduct an audit of all deliverables ) not correct because Audit conducts on processes not deliverables. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 500]

column2: Which of the following techniques can ensure that the stakeholders are engaged at appropriate project phases and to obtain or confirm their continued commitment to the success of the project?
column7: Stage-gate or phase review meetings give to project stakeholders a chance to review project progress and planned future actions. This gives them a chance to have their voice heard and recorded. The rest of the choices are techniques that are internal to a project. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 21]

column2: What should the project manager refer to evaluate the resources that assign by the project management office (PMO)?
column7: The resource management plan is the component of the project management plan that provides guidance on how project resources should be evaluated, categorized, allocated, managed, and released. The resource management plan include also the team performance assessment criteria. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 339].

column2: One of the key stakeholders requested additional features to be added to the product without changing the scope, budget, or schedule. The project manager believes that these features will add great value to the end product. However, these additions will increase project costs and impact the project schedule. Which process should the project manager have followed before including the additional project feature?
column7: The Change Management used to: 1. Describes how to manage the changes, addresses the change control board (CCB). 2.specifies how the project scope may be changed, the procedure to change the scope, and the requirements to make a change. 3. Ensure that inappropriate changes to the project scope do not occur. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page115]

column2: The completion date for a critical milestone is approaching, but a shared team is unable to commit to achieving it on schedule. What should the project manager do to meet the milestone date?
column3: Ask the client to change the milestone date.
column5: Remind the shared team about the milestone's importance.
column6: Approach the shared team's functional manager to request additional support.
column7: The project manager is working in a weak matrix or functional organization. SO the project manager should approach the shared team's functional manager to request additional support. Option ( Remind the shared team about the milestone's importance. ) not good action because they already unable to commit to achieving it on schedule. Option ( Request the additional resources.) not correct because the project manager have no authority and should ask the functional manager for support. Option ( Ask the client to change the milestone date. ) not good practice in such situation. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 213].

column2: The project manager works in risk management and creating a risk register. The risk register records details of all the risks identified at the beginning and during the life of the project. What tool or technique should the project manager use to generate a list of all possible project risks?
column7: Brainstorming is a data-gathering technique that can be used for identify risk process and The goal of brainstorming is to obtain a comprehensive list of individual project risks and sources of overall project risk. [PMBOK 6th edition page, 414]

column2: You have identified a risk that may cause safety concerns for the workers completing the task. You've decided to hire a third party to complete this work because the risk is too great to accept internally. Which risk response is this?
column7: The transfer involves shifting ownership of a threat to a third party to manage the risk and to bear the impact if the threat occurs. Agreements may be used to transfer ownership and liability for specified risks to another party. A is incorrect because mitigation is any effort to reduce or eliminate the risk. B is incorrect because acceptance means just that: the risk has been accepted. C is incorrect because avoidance is changing the project management plan to avoid the risk altogether. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 443 ]

column2: You are the project manager of a large IT project. During the implementation phase, you sign a contract to rent an additional server from a local company because of the possibility that the main server may fail due to constant, local-area electrical outages. As a project manager, what strategy are you using?
column7: In risk mitigation, the action is taken to reduce the probability of occurrence and/or impact of a threat. the project manager wants to reduce the probability and impact by renting the generator.[PMBOK 6th edition, Page 443]

column2: You and your team have done extensive brainstorming and discussions. You have also looked up the organizations process assets and have come up with an exhaustive list of risks. You and your team members feel fairly confident now that you know all the risks. You decide to prioritize the risks and only focus on the high priority ones. A team member indicates that a large number of risks have very low priority. What should you do next?
column7: After performing Qualitative Risk Analysis, the Risk Register is updated included watch list which stated the low priority Risks for continued monitoring. [PMBOK 6th edition. Page 427].

column2: Your project manager has advised that you need to protect the organization from financial risk. In planning a new project, you realize there is a limited scope definition related to the work required to fulfill the contract. What is the best type of contract to choose?
column7: When you have a project with limited scope, the most suitable type of contract is Cost-reimbursable contracts. This type should be used if the scope of work is expected to change significantly during the execution of the contract. We have two types of Cost-reimbursable contracts in the options given ( Cost plus incentive fee and Cost plus a fixed fee. Both the risk lies on the buyer but Cost plus incentive fee the risk is lower than the cost plus fixed fee where the buyer has to pay a fixed fee along with the cost incurred, but the Cost plus incentive fee the buyer pays the fee based on achieving certain performance objectives mentioned in the contract. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 472].

column10: ιΆθιε΅ ικ«Ά©§΅  ιΰε΅ ιξ ι©«νκ ι£ Ά΅ (CPFF).

column2: By the project management information system (PMIS), a project management team is updating a dashboard monthly with information on the project's performance. Which of the following communication methods describes this?
column7: Since (dashboard) is update monthly with information on the project's performance to help the internal and external stakeholders to get the information any time by using the PMIS. its an example of pull communication. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 374]

column2: You are a project manager for an construction project. During the implementation phase, you found that there is a great opportunity and you decide to transfer the ownership of an opportunity to a third party so that it shares some of the benefits if the opportunity occurs. Therefore, a joint venture was made with another company to catch these benefits. Now, you became responsible for the project as a whole. What will your next step be?
column7: Due to a joint venture was made So next step should be updated communication management plan because its contains Stakeholder communication requirements , Information to be communicated, including language, format, content, and level of detail, Timeframe and frequency for the distribution of required information and receipt of acknowledgment or response. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 387]

column2: A multiphase project that has been executed with internal resources has reached a phase gate. The key project stakeholders want to determine if the phase has met its success criteria, and whether or not the project should progress to the next phase. In addition to the project management plan, which documents will be required?
column4: Lessons learned register and lessons learned repository
column7: The business documents and project charter are needed to determine whether or not the project should progress to the next phase. The project charter will provide the project's success criteria. The business documents include the business case and benefits management plan. The business case documents the business need and the cost-benefit analysis that justifies the project. The benefits management plan is used to measure whether the benefits of the project are being achieved as planned. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 21]

column2: You are a program manager of a project that is halfway through the execution. Because of the increased volatility of prices, one of the vendors asks you to make a price change that will affect the project contract. As a program manager, what should you do next?
column5: Analyze the impact and Update the Project management plan
column6: Submit a change request and analyze the impact
column7: As a price change will affect the project contract, the project manager should Submit a change request and analyze the impact then take approval from CCB then update affected baselines then Implement the approved change. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page115]

column2: While reviewing the statement of work (SOW) for the project, four stakeholders not agree on what the project should include. As a project manager, What should you do?
column3: Document the conflict in the issue log before participating in the development of the project charter.
column4: Include the stakeholders' comments for future reference in the project charter.
column5: Document the stakeholders' points but include the remaining stakeholders' input in final decision making.
column6: Hold a meeting with the four stakeholders to resolve the conflict and reach agreement.
column7: Conflict management is a part of Interpersonal and team skills that can be used for the initiation process. Conflict management can be used to help bring stakeholders into alignment on the objectives, success criteria, high-level requirements, project description, summary milestones, and other elements of the charter. so the project manager should be proactive and meet with the four stakeholders to resolve the conflict and reach an agreement. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 80]

column2: A project manager was assigned to a project when the project charter was in development. Which of the following is an input that the project manager will use to develop the project charter?
column3: Enterprise environmental factors and Project Acceptance Criteria
column5: Organizational Process Assets and Project Scope Statement
column6: Cost Benefit Analysis and organizational strategies
column7: A business case includes Cost-Benefit Analysis and organizational strategies. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 68,75]

column2: You are working on a project to construct villa in your city, and you are about to start project planning. As a starting point for initial project planning, what is the first thing you should do?
column3: Conduct a project kick-off meeting to inform and engage stakeholders and gain commitment.
column4: Begin the process of identifying stakeholders so they can be engaged as necessary for project planning.
column5: Develop the project schedule to manage timely completion of the project
column6: Review the project charter to understand the high-level information about the project.
column7: The question states that project planning is about to begin which suggests that project initiation has been completed. The project charter is created during the Develop Project Charter process as part of project initiation. The project team uses the project charter as a starting point for initial project planning. The type and amount of information in the project charter varies depending on the complexity of the project and the information known at the time of its creation. At a minimum, the project charter should define the high-level information about the project that will be elaborated in the various components of the project management plan. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 81].

column7: When identifying a new stakeholder during the project, the First step is to update the Stakeholder register. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 529]

column2: You are a project manager in a infrastructure project. During a review, the site engineer informs you that the concrete production rate has changed over the last three months. What analysis should be conducted?
column7: Trend analysis examines project performance over time to determine whether performance is improving or deteriorating. Graphical analysis techniques are valuable for understanding performance to date and for comparing to future performance goals in the form of completion dates. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 227]

column2: You has been assigned as a project manager, you are managing a software development project. As a result of observation and conversation, you notice some of the team members need to improve their skills. What should you do FIRST?
column4: Schedule training sessions for the team members to optimize their performance.
column7: The Resource Management Plan include training strategies and methods for developing the project team. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 319]

column2: You are a project manager in an IT project. During the deployment of a new system, an unexpected power outage occurs. What should the project manager do?
column6: Refer to the risk register and inform key stakeholder.
column7: As an unexpected power outage occurs, the project manager should first Refer to the risk register and inform key stakeholders to handle this scenario. Risk categorization and Risk probability and impact assessment are T&T in Perform a qualitative risk analysis process, therefore they can be excluded. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 411, 458].

column2: During the middle of the project, the project manager has been exposed to an accident, and a new project manager has been assigned. What should the new project manager do next?
column7: Since he is a new project manager, so the communication management plan should be updated. Also, the resource management plan is a component of the project management plan. Option update project charter is incorrect because the sponsor who can update or modify the project charter according to PMBOK.

column2:
Using the following values, calculate the Management reserve: 
Project Budget = 100,000
EAC = 120,000
AC = 5,500
BAC=70,000
column7: The Management reserve = Project Budget - BAC. Therefore, 100,000 - 70,000 = 30,000. [PMBOK 6th edition. Page 267].

column2: You are in the middle of your project and working on a deliverable which is 85% completed. It is time for the yearly audit. A team of auditors are about to come and verify if you are following the process as defined or not. However, as the deliverable is about to be completed, you check it and measure all dimensions to find any possible dimensional defects. What process is this?
column7: In the quality control process, you inspect the deliverable for any possible defects. As you are doing an inspection, you are in the quality control process. Please note that although the quality audit is performed in the manage quality process, it has not started yet and you are doing an inspection, which is a tool of the quality control process. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 303]

column2: You have been managing a construction new industries project in a developing country, and now you are closing the project. The project completed on schedule and under budget. The general manager of your company heard about the success of your project and wants a summary overview of project performance so that he can talk about your success at the next board meeting. What should you provide to him?
column7: The scenario suggests the project has been closed. In other words, the Close Project or Phase process is now complete. The final report is one of the outputs from this process. The final report includes information such as a summary level description of the project, a summary of any risks and issues encountered and how they were addressed, a summary of how the final product, service or result was achieved, and more. Since the vice president wants a summary overview of project results, providing the vice president with the final report will likely meet their needs and is, therefore, of the choices provided, the best answer to the question asked. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 127]

column2: A project has been initiated that has several project stakeholders from various departments. Some stakeholders are unavailable for the facilitation meeting to discuss end-to-end processes. To satisfy their own personal agenda, the project owner requests that the meeting take place without all stakeholder's present. What should the project manager do?
column3: Discuss stakeholder availability with the sponsor.
column4: Hold a separate meeting with those stakeholders who are unavailable.
column5: Reschedule the meeting to accommodate all stakeholders.
column6: Set up a facilitation meeting without all stakeholders to obtain initial requirements.
column7: Set up a facilitation meeting without all stakeholders to obtain initial requirements, then hold a separate meeting with those stakeholders who are unavailable. Option (Reschedule the meeting to accommodate all stakeholders) not correct because the project owner requests that the meeting take place without all stakeholder's present. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 514]

column2: A company has recurring quality issues with one of its sole source suppliers. A new project will incur significant penalties from the end users if deliverables are late What should the project manager do?
column3: Escalate the issue to top management
column4: Negotiate with other vendors with better quality-control methods.
column5: Review incoming inspection reports and quality logs
column6: Identify high- level risks prior to developing contingency plans
column7: In the (past projects) ,the company has recurring quality issues with one of its sole source suppliers. in the new project will incur significant penalties from the customer if deliverables are late. So this is high level risk and should be initially take into consideration , then in the planning phase, the project manager should conducts a mitigation plan to reduce this risk such as conduct more tests and Review incoming inspection reports and quality logs. Since its sole source then you don't have any other option to negotiate with other vendors with better quality-control methods.. Therefor you have to consider this risk while you are planning the project. Since you should be proactive so the escalation process to top management is the last decision. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 442, 443].

column2: During project closure and transferring of the completed project deliverables to the operations department, the construction manager discovers that an audit report from an early project phase is missing. What should the construction manager do?
column3: Ask the operations group to accept the project without the audit report.
column4: Complete project closure and Update the OPA
column5: Remove the audit report from the required project documents and update the project management plan
column6: Inform the operations group about the missing audit report.
column7: Ethically, the project manager must inform the operations group about the missing audit report. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 127].

column2: Without consulting the project manager, an operational manager relocate the key project resources in order to assign them operational tasks. Since these resources are now focused on operational tasks rather than deliverables, the deliverables run late. What should the project manager do first?
column3: Ask to have the resources replaced immediately.
column4: Escalate the functional manager's actions to the sponsor.
column6: Negotiate time allocation to prioritize the resources' workload.
column7: The functional manager removes key project resources in order to assign them operational tasks. The scenario ask what should you do FIRST. The project manager should FIRST Negotiate time allocation to prioritize the resources' workload. It's a strategic way to distribute the work throughout your team to keep your teams busy and productive. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 357].

column2: As you are project manager in the final closing project phase. Which of the following should you as the project manager refer to ensure that requirements approved in the requirements documentation are delivered?
column7: The requirements traceability matrix is a grid that links product requirements from their origin to the deliverables that satisfy them. The implementation of a requirements traceability matrix helps ensure that each requirement adds business value by linking it to the business and project objectives. It provides a means to track requirements throughout the project life cycle, helping to ensure that requirements approved in the requirements documentation are delivered at the end of the project. Finally, it provides a structure for managing changes to the product scope.. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 148]

column2: A project has a senior stakeholder whose input is important, and who needs to be kept informed about the project's status. Rather than receive updates from the project manager, this stakeholder prefers to contact a team member directly. The stakeholder has a connection with this team members that is unrelated to the project and thinks that this is a way to obtain information on the project's true status. What should the project manager do?
column3: Keep the team member properly informed about project status so that the stakeholder receives the same information from both sources.
column4: Leave the connection in place, since the information coming via the team member is unofficial and will not create problems.
column5: Tell the team member not to accept calls from the stakeholder, because these calls have an adverse effect on the team member's productivity.
column6: Ask the stakeholder how the additional information that they feel is missing from current communications may be provided.
column7: The best answer is to ask the stakeholder how the additional information that they feel is missing from current communications may be provided, in order to update the Communication Management Plan. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 379]

column3: Meet with stakeholders to communicate the schedule budget, and cost impact in the event of a project delay.
column4: Establish a management reserve to handle the unknown risks when occurs
column6: Identify the project's risks and necessary success criteria.
column7: Identify the project's risks and the necessary success criteria. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 417]

column2: The project in execution phase, unidentified stakeholder request a change on project schedule. As a project manager, What should you do first?
column4: Meeting with the team and analyze the impact on project constraints
column7: Since the Stakeholder Unidentified, then the stakeholder should be identified first and update stakeholder register before analyzing the impact on project constraints. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 529]

column2: During the control quality process, the quality inspectors have discovered a many number of defects on the deliverables. The project owner told the project manager go proceed to validate scope process for approval. As a project manager, What should you do next?
column4: Ignore the sponsor and direct team to complete the deliverables
column5: Request training for the team members and rework
column6: Evaluate the impact of defects on the project and inform the sponsor
column7: The project manager should first Evaluate the impact of defects on the project and inform the sponsor. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 305].

column2: You are a construction manager assigned to a new seaport construction project. You want to create WBS but the project is new to your company and there is no previous experience and documentation as a reference. Which of the following tools will help the project manager?
column7: Since the project is new to your company and there is no previous experience and documentation as a reference. It requires subject matter experts. PMBOK 6th edition, Page 158 ].

column2: The project manager is trying to get hand over for a series of marketing materials. The work is rejected by the key stakeholders responsible for sign off because of incorrect use of marketing standards and specification. What should the project manager do before sending materials to the key stakeholders again?
column3: Validate the scope before performing quality control
column4: Create a work breakdown structure before validating the scope
column5: Validate scope before communicating the project status
column6: Perform quality control checks before validating the scope
column7: In the scenario, the work is being validated by the stakeholders, but there are quality concerns noted by the incorrect use of standards. Ideally, the Control Quality process should be completed before the scope can be validated. It is unclear from the scenario whether or not this process has been carried out at all. Regardless, now, when the issues have been found during scope validation, it is essential that before repeating the Validate Scope process for this work, the project manager and the project team conduct the Control Quality process to ensure correctness and proper adherence to the marketing quality standards. Then the scope can be validated based on both correctness and completeness.  [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 298].

column2: You are working in a matrix organization and managing a project. The human resource manager transferred some resources you need from your project to another project without take in consideration the effect of this action on your project. What should you do next?
column3: Escalate this problem to the sponsor
column4: Complete the project without this resources
column6: Negotiate with Functional Manager to assign a new resources
column7: In matrix organizations environment The project manager should effectively negotiate and influence others who are in a position to provide the required team and physical resources for the project. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 329,330].

column2: A buyer sent the quotation (RFQ) to the potential sellers. After a certain days, some potential sellers have questions about the terms and conditions. As a project manager, to ensure that all vendors have a clear and common understanding, what should you do?
column4: Send a clarification to the vendors via email.
column5: Conduct one- to-one meeting with vendors.
column7: After receiving a request for quotation (RFQ) and prior to proposal submittal , some potential sellers have questions about the terms and conditions. 50 the project manager should conduct a Bidder conference (also called contractor conferences, vendor conferences, and pre-bid conferences) this meeting between the buyer and prospective sellers prior to proposal submittal. They are used to ensure that all prospective bidders have a clear and common understanding of the procurement and no bidders receive preferential treatment. [PMBOK 6th edition page, 477].

column2: A project manager is working with the project team to estimate durations for the identified project activities. The team is looking to achieve the most accurate estimate possible. What estimating technique can they use to generate the desired result?
column7: Three-point estimating, it uses three estimates (most likely, optimistic, and pessimistic) to calculate the average value of activity duration. It reduces the bias, risks, and uncertainties from the duration calculation. It is more accurate than the analogous technique and Parametric estimating. Analogous estimating is also referred to as top-down estimating.  [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 201].

column2: The project in closure phase now, what is the activity necessary to transfer the project's products, services, or results to production and/or operations group?
column4: Complete the preventive and corrective actions
column5: Monitoring implementation of approved changes as they occur

column2: You have been recently assigned as a project manager in a big infrastructure project. A strike by local workers occurs due to the lateness workers' payments. That leads to delays in a major component delivery. What is the process the project manager could have been done differently to prevent this type of situation?
column7: To prevent this type of situation, we must go to the planning. So the choices that fall into the monitoring and control process group are wrong and identify stakeholder is not related to the question. When developing the schedule, we define milestones regarding event and progress related payments. The timeline development process involves analyzing a what-if scenario as a tool. What-if scenario snalysis  is the process of evaluating scenarios in order to predict their positive or negative impact on project objectives. The schedule network analysis is performed using the schedule to account for various scenarios, such as delay in delivery of a major component due to strike. [PMBOK 6th edition, page 213].

column4: Perform a Qualitative and Quantitative risk analysis
column7: Before obtaining the project approval and buy-in, the project manager should complete a stakeholder analysis to align expectations and gain support for the project and facilitate project closure. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 512].

column2: You have just been assigned as the project manager for an ongoing project in your organization. You have discovered there is no Project Charter that describes the responsibilities and authorities of the project manager. When you talked to your project sponsor about this issue, he told you that your organization has executed many projects in the past without ever using a Project Charter. What will you do?
column3: Create a draft project charter and submit to your supervisor
column4: Create the project charter and inform project team members to ensure common understanding of the key deliverables and their roles and responsibilities
column5: Conduct the project kick-off meeting and inform everyone that the project has started
column6: Discuss the need to have a project charter with the sponsor
column7: The project charter establishes a partnership between the performing and requesting organizations. Projects are initiated by an entity external to the project such as a sponsor, program, or project management office (PMO), or a portfolio governing body chairperson or authorized representative. The project initiator or sponsor is responsible for approve and issue the charter and can take the help of the prospect project manager to develop it. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 77].

column2: You are managing a critical project with frequent changes in requirement. You are in the testing phase of the project, and the customer has requested the addition of a new feature. You have assessed the impact of the change on the triple constraints with your team. What should be your NEXT step?
column3: Update the project management plans and other project documents including project baselines
column4: Look for alternative options including schedule compression techniques like crashing and fast tracking
column5: Raise a change request form and send it for approval to change control board
column6: Analyze the impact of the change on the project's quality objectives and quality planning
column7:
Testing is an organized and constructed investigation conducted to provide objective information about the quality
of the product or service under test in accordance with the project requirements. The intent of testing is to find errors,
defects, bugs, or other nonconformance problems in the product or service. The type, amount, and extent of tests
needed to evaluate each requirement are part of the project quality plan and depend on the nature of the project, time,
budget, and other constraints. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 303]

column2: A recently promoted project manager must facilitate the monthly status update meeting. What should the project manager do to ensure a productive meeting?
column3: Limit attendance to the project team and stakeholders
column4: Avoid or smooth over any disagreements
column5: Carefully read the latest meeting minutes

column2: You are managing a complex construction project and you request a seven-year schedule for this project. Although multiple brainstorming sessions with your project team, you struggle to provide detail for the project management plan. This causes a delay in obtaining the project management plan approvals. As a project manager, what should you have done to avoid this situation?
column4: Used subject matter expert to develop the detailed schedule.
column5: Created a high level Gantt chart to represent the milestone only
column6: Used the rolling wave planning technique for activity planning
column7:
Since the project manager struggles to provide details for the project management plan, so the project manager should have used iterative planning to avoid this situation. Recurring planning is a method in which the work that will be accomplished in the near term is accurately planned and the work that will be executed in the remote periods is planned at a high level until more details are clear that enables it to be carefully re-planned in the coming periods.
 [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 185].

column2: An approved change request adds an incentive to a lump sum contract if the contractor is able to maintain the current baseline schedule. What should now be updated?

Only the cost baseline will be updated due to this approved change request. No need to update the whole project management plan because you update the affected plan or baseline only. [PMBOK 6th edition Page, 115]

column2: A Project manager is estimating an activity duration in the project schedule. As per the following data, what is the activity's expected time? - Optimistic time (O) is three weeks. - Pessimistic time (P) is seven weeks. - Most likely time (M) is five weeks.
column7:
The formula for three-point estimate (based on triangular distribution) is: 
Estimate = (Optimistic + (Most Likely ) + Pessimistic)/3.
= ( 3+7+5) / 3 = 5 weeks . 
Note: to estimate activity duration, use triangular distribution, while the cost estimation you can use triangular or beta distribution. [PMBOK 6th edition, Page 201].
